text: Prices are good! Never in a million years thought gluten free treats would be this good.
The cheesecake was YUMMY!!! Had a tsoynami with cherry pie filling, vanilla wafers and vanilla ice cream very good.
The tsoynami was okay, but brunch was definitely sub par especially for $10... I had high expectations because of all of the positive reviews but felt underwhelmed and disappointed

Incredible. Discovered this place by word of social media, and did not regret it one bit!  I had the "Betterfinger" tsoyonami, and my boyfriend had a raspberry mocha. The tsoyonomi was delicious - after not having ice cream or anything that resembles it for a year, it was liquid gold to my palette. I also sampled his raspberry mocha, which was just as delightful. It had a rich mocha flavor with just the right amount of sweet raspberry to where it was distinct but not overpowering. The staff was also very helpful, and they seemed to have a great camaraderie behind the bar, which is always a good sign. I would go back in a heartbeat.

I love, love, love Nami!  I am not a vegan but EASILY could be with treats like the ones served there.  

The Oatmeal Cream Pie (OCP), chocolate chip cookie, peanut butter and chocolate candy bar, soynamis, etc., etc., etc.  Everything is delicious!  

The coffee is also awesome.  In fact, it is so good that I've gone in just for an Americano (and somehow managed to not get a sweet to go with it).  

The staff is super-friendly, too.  They are always smiling and pleasant.

Nami is the perfect all vegan place for a treat during the crazy AZ summers! Their tsoynamis never disappoint and with so many options for mix ins, you can try something new every time you go! The chocolate soft serve is my favorite (they also have vanilla or swirl) and their ricemellow fluff is the yummiest mix in! I also absolutely love their vegan donuts and am so happy that they always have at least one gluten free option to choose from. The only thing that I'm not a huge fan of is the coffee which is very acidic and has an odd aftertaste.

Best breakfast burrito ever! I can't wait to come back to Phoenix so I can eat here again. I don't even like soy cheese but the country breakfast burrito rocked my world.. I would have loved to eat it with a fork and knife on a plate, but even in its basket the taste was amazing and I know I'll be craving it until my next Arizona adventure. Service was super friendly, my latte with hazelnut milk was on point, and the garlicky salsa that came with the burrito was pure magic. 

They only serve breakfast, and the menu isn't up on the board as that is full of all the bakery treats and beverages. I'd love to see a larger menu, or even some menus by the door for more accessibility. Luckily I knew about the food from yelp, so I just asked the people in front of me to pass a menu back. It's a little awkward to not be able to see a menu until it's your turn to order if others are in line behind you. Overall, great job Nami! You've got to taste it to believe it.

Excellent alternative to froyo and the normal packed coffee house in the neighborhood. Nice atmosphere. Easy place to work on papers or meet with friends. Good coffee, good sweets, and good frozen treats. Try a tsoynami with some frozen fruit and be open to trying some vegan quiches. Parking is scarce, so be sure to carpool. Get your hipster fix in an unpretentious way.

I've have used Yelp several times to find great places to eat, but unfortunately my first review is going to have to be negative :(  I visited Nami with a friend the other night and had a pretty bad experience. Basically, the prices were not truthfully stated, the customer service was selective/awful depending on who you are and what you ask, and they seem to be lacking in their regard for those with food allergies.

The long version:
It's a cute place and seemed busy with a mostly young, artistic crowd hanging out. After staring at the main menu for a minute trying to figure out where the ice cream was, an employee handed us a separate menu to see the ice cream selection. My friend ordered first, and then I ordered. Everything seemed normal and fine up to this point, but when the cashier told me the price was $5.50 as opposed to the $4.50 listed on the menu, I was a little taken aback ( I hadn't added any toppings) and politely asked why the price jump. 

She suddenly became very short with me, almost angry, started handling everything roughly while telling me that there was tax and also that chocolate always cost more (which wasn't previously stated anywhere that I could find). I felt intimidated by her and wanted ice cream, so I said it wasn't a problem and paid. My friend was perplexed at what had just happened and was more angry about the situation than I was at the moment, but I started feeling more annoyed when I turned around to see the same cashier helping the guy behind me and being sweet and flirty with him. Clearly it wasn't just a bad mood that I had accidentally been met with. 

When I got my dessert, they called the wrong name (the cashier had never bothered to ask). I was getting sick of everything and thought it would be nice to sit outside, but we had barely taken our seats when a random guy off the street who didn't appear to be a paying customer took the table next to us and proceeded to ask if we minded if he smoked. My friend misheard the question and said it was fine, so he lit up. I realize we were downtown and you can only control your patios so much, but I was over it and motioned for us to leave. 

Finally, I quickly noticed I was having a mild allergic reaction. I am moderately allergic to peanuts (more akin to food poisoning than anaphylactic shock), and this was the sensation I get when I've eaten a small amount. I had worried earlier that the mixing bowls might not be cleaned adequately between batches, and it seemed my fears were realized. Both my friend and I decided we won't be visiting there again.

I was in Phoenix from L.A. for a concert and after having dinner at Green, we woke up the next day and came to Nami for breakfast before heading home. Vegan doughnuts! Vegan egg mcmuffin! So so yummy!!

Had a Banana Cream Pie tSoynami and it was delicious, and grabbed a Vegan Victory Bar and even though it had a dark green color to it, it was still great to top off my Calexico Burger from Green next door...I'm def coming here more often
Yummy! Everything is so good!! My fav is the Betterfinger Tsoynami!!

It's definitely a treat.  I got to split one with a friend after eating at Green and it was excellent.  A nice alternative for avoiding dairy.

Not sure of the flavor, but pretty sure it had bananas and cookies.  One is more than enough to share with multiple people especially after a meal.

Another great place in the central corridor

My best friend and I would get deserts here all the time in Phoenix.  This is hands down one of the best places to go get ice-cream when the hot Phoenix summers are weighing down on you. The staff is friendly and super amazing at helping you find the perfect eats.

This place is amazing. I wish I heard of it sooner. Perfect place to satisfy a sweet tooth while staying healthy! Only reason I gave 4stars is because they were out of doughnuts which I am eager to go back and try

I take back my previous review. Over time I have tried different options at Nami and it has become a favorite place for me. You get quite a bit of soy ice cream for your money - usually more than I can eat in one sitting and they now have chocolate soy ice cream as well. My favorites are the Dough Boy and Almond Oy Vey! I love that all of the things on their menu are vegan, and my husband who is not a vegan, thinks their cookie dough cupcake is the best cupcake in the world! For my husband to think that highly of a dessert is an incredible complement because let me tell you, he has the biggest sweet tooth!

I am here at least once a week and I love the "no's n mint" tsoymami. The location it cute with great decor. Parking can be tough depending on the day of the week so be prepared to go to plan B. the proves can seem high for ice cream but once you get the ice cream you'll understand.  portions are huge.

Came here to meet my tutor for some late night studying + ice cream. The ice cream was awesome and they had a ton of things to mix in - delicious! Someone nearby got some curry thing that smelled amazing - really interested in trying some of the food and tofu selections. Looks good! I'd definitely be back sooner if I didn't live so far.

The tSoynamis are wonderful. They are expensive, but is a nice once-in-a-while treat.

My only suggestion to the manager: Please place PRICES on your pastries and sweets displayed in the glass case. (ie. doughnuts, muffins, cake, etc). I'm not in favor of unpriced items.

It is a slight inconvenience for me to have to ask your staff member what the prices are on each item-I don't want to hold up the line. I want to do the math and make my selections BEFORE approaching the register. I think others would feel the same way.

Pricing each item (sweets in the window) gives courtesy to your customers and holds the business accountable for accuracy in numbers. This ensures that the customer knows exactly how much he/she is being charged for tax.

Vegan paradise!  
We need more places like Nami in the midwest.  Drived through 7th Ave and was pleasantly suprised by this little joint.  Service was friendly and prompt, and the food was fantastic!

I came here one day with my cousin. Her son can't have any Dairy and always requests Ice cream from here. So I decided to tag along.. I mean I have sensitivity to dairy myself so why not. I ordered the Almond Oy Vey! And Oy Vey was it good! I definitely will be back again... And again and again! Nami you gained a new non dairy follower

Best vegan desserts in Arizona . PERIOD !!! From their soy based frozen concoctions called tsoynamis to their vegan pastries, breakfast and coffees! 

They make vanilla, chocolate or a swirl of both. My go to ones are chunkey monkey and peanut butter and banana. But wanted to try something different so tonight we tried the pumpkin pie tsoynami and hubby got the banana cream pie tsoynami ( he always get that one but I would prefer it with peanut butter and chocolate) and OMG the pumpkin pie tsoynami is AMAZING..... The pumpkin puree is so good , you can actually taste it....it definitely isnt covered up by all the spices.....just pure pumpkin with vanilla and Graham crackers. YUM.....

Again friendly staff, small seating area but always fortunate to find seating every single time we are here (thank you universe). They too have outdoor seating but their parking can be a bit of a pain. 

Go get dinner before hand next door and come here for dessert! You will not regret it....after all peace begins on our plate !

I'm visiting phoenix and have been here twice in the last 24 hours. I initially thought it was closed when i came and it looked pitch black, but it was the building next door that was packed with a line out the door at 830pm. It's delicious and all vegan. I'm told the cactus haboob was the best latte my friend has ever had. The brunch was yummy and so was the tsoynami. I'll be back next time I'm in town. I can't wait to try the rodney dangerfield and have another tsoynami!

Was recommended to try this place out per my new yelp friend Christine. Came here for brunch and have to admit that their Carmel latte w/almond milk is by far better than Starbucks! We couldn't leave without getting their famous tSoynami (clunky monkey), can't believe it was dairy free...YUM!!!

Just had their Gluten Free raspberry donut and again I am so impressed. Before eating gf donuts were my go to feel good food. I have tried assorted bakery and boxed types to no avail. This donut was moist, not dry or gritty like others. The flavor was exceptional and the frosting on top made it the absolute best GF Donut I have had to date.
This place is so cozy and the vegan/gluten free food is amazing. You can't go wrong with the treats they serve here

There was more foam (an inch deep) then coffee in my small cactus haboob. The Nami Mcbagel sandwich was alright, all I could taste is the spicy part of the salsa. Honestly I was very disappointed with the service as well, they forgot my friends plain bagel... It was the first thing we order. The fruit was delicious though!

OMG, Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough tSoynami is like crack to me! My favorite ice cream before going vegan was Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough so I was psyched when I saw this here. I was not disappointed! No, it's not as creamy as "real" ice cream, but it beyond hit the spot for me. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE IT! 

I did order some other desserts. I'm sure they were okay, but nothing could hold a candle to that cookie dough. I think it put me in a heavenly dessert blackout. I believe we also ordered Lavender Tea cookies, White Chocolate Raspberry cupcake, and Vanilla and Chocolate milkshakes. Don't judge! 

As everyone has mentioned, the parking is a nightmare. I went at an off time to minimize the trauma as I drive a CUV. My passenger had to get out and guide me into a space. It was sooo worth it. I would do it again!

Popped in here while I waited for my food at Green to be served. Ordered a latte and waited to be called. Two girls behind the counter service coffee and ice cream constantly touched their hair and faces while leisurely serving up their customers requests. I guess when you serve such pristine vegan confections without all the icky yucky animal products, face and hair germs arent a factor. When it's vegan your already doing a good thing, amiright? Good latte nonetheless.
We are so glad we found this place! Great sushi and delicious miso soup. They have some great menu options as well!

Vegan breakfast  includes donuts, acai bowls and some salads. The food was not the best tasting or texture. My friend got an acai bowl that was huge and soupy. The donut was okay, the salad was a little rich for a breakfast item and a big portion. Not my favorite place.

This place was busy.... Good sign usually.  The food wasn't extraordinary to me; but it was nevertheless very good, fresh, healthy, and the staff was nice and place is clean. So it's definitely worth coming back

Good food and thoroughly enjoy their brunch, but they need to figure out a system for to go orders. I am standing in a very long line waiting to pay even though I called the order in. What a waste of my time! Figure it out guys. And yes, I even asked one of the employees and was told I had to wait...
Love Nami, we go almost every Sunday for brunch. Such a great idea they separated Green from Nami. The sage sausage scramble is definitely a must-try. Great atmosphere and people
They have the best vegan desserts I have ever had! Staff is friendly and efficient. I love this place!!!

My wife and I always stop in during the week we love the breakfast and the  namis! the dough boy is bomb...  it's my all time favorite....we love samantha! She has the best attitude there  and knows what we usually order.

I love Nami! I love their breakfast, I love their desserts, I love their coffee! 
The only thing that could make Nami better is if they had a location closer to my house. Even if that never happens Ill still make the drive :)

This place is awesome. The acai and Pitaya bowls are super tasty. They have great coffee and the perfect thing to pair with good coffee are their amazing vegan doughnuts. I haven't tried anything on the menu that I didn't like. So excited to have this Vegan jewel in my hood. Everyone that works here is friendly and fun!!

Everything here is awesome. Good coffee good baked treats, and their tsoynami frozen desserts are amazing. The betterfinger is delicious and what my dreams are made of. Plus everyone who works here is really nice and also super babes.
BE STILL MY BLIZZARD LOVING HEART. I've never found a vegan soft serve joint that makes blizzard like treats for the dairy free folks. I must return for their donuts.

If you are vegan, gluten free or both, this is your place for desserts. Due to health problems, I also get left out of desserts after dinner with my friends. At Nami, we can all enjoy a dessert including myself. The brunch is also delicious especially on Sundays!

This place has the best vegan treats I have tried. The ice cream is delicious, not too sweet but not too bland. The cookies taste almost like regular dairy cookies, same with the cheesecake. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are fair. If you're ever in the area and craving something sweet you should give this place a try!

One of my favorite places to get coffee, besides Seattle Espresso in Chandler.  The best thing about this place is everything is Vegan and tasty.  Even people that aren't vegan love this place.  The people that work here are awesome and friendly.  Try their biscuits and gravy!

I never knew Vegan sweets could taste so good. The tSoynamis are amazing particularly the classic peanut butter and chocolate flavor combination.  These tSoynamis are similar to a blizzard in the sense that it is a soft serve type ice cream with mix ins...that's when comparisons end though.  The ice cream here is vegan although the texture isn't quite as soft as traditional soft serve it's still pretty smooth on the whole.

The baked goods are also quite delicious and quite massive.

The prices are a little on the high side though and would add up quickly if one came here all the time for a coffee or dessert. Still need to try the brunch.

This place is so neat with an amazing selection. I ordered their Soy Captain tsoynami which is vanilla "ice cream", strawberries and vegan captain crunch. It was delicious and a great treat for a hot day! The staff is also very friendly and personable. I will be definitely be returning.
Amazing place. Everyone is no nice and accommodating. The food is very fresh and very tasty. I highly recommend it!! They are great with large groups too!

Finally went here with hubby and it did not disappoint. Split the Mash tsoynami and the pecan gluten free doughnut with him. Both delish!! Another thing I love is how it is next door to The Green restaurant. Walked right over and had a lunch. Wrote a review for them too!!

The service was quick and kind. The food good but I'm no vegetarian or vegan so I've had much creamier ice cream but I'm sure it's very enjoyable for anyone that is not able to consume traditional dairy desserts.

Their peanut butter and chocolate tSoynami was good but not great.  I'm not vegan, and I prefer dairy ice cream, but I've had vegan ice cream I liked better than this (especially coconut milk ice cream).  Also, the chocolate reminded me of Hershey's syrup.
OMG is what you will say when you taste their yummy nami!! Phenomenal and amazing!! I've had it all at this place, my favorite go to for large portions and variety of flavors

I am so excited about this!
I have a dairy allergy and am pretty use to coffee shops using the cheapest soy milk they can find to pacify us non-dairy people, and then typically charge an extra $.50 for it. 

Nami is all vegan.  I was pleasantly surprised when I went there and asked for a  latte and they asked me, "would you like that made with soy, hazelnut, almond, or coconut milk?"  WHAT!?! choices?  They also informed me that once they get more settled they want to start making fresh nut milks.  
The hazelnut latte is awesome.  Also, the "Nami Cakes" are soooo good.

This is my favorite Ice cream place in town. If you are turned off by the whole "vegan thing" don't be! They make better ice cream then the cold stone creamery. I had the banana cream pie toysomi with vanilla ice-cream and it was amazing! I will definitely go again.

I can't say enough great things about this place. You can't pick a bad item to get. Everyone who works to serve up delicious treats there is awesome. My favorite is going on Sunday's when brunch is available, but any day with a Nami visit is a good day!
It's taking 30 minutes to get a small soft serve ice cream! Nothing special, no fancy order, just straight out of the machine! 30 FRIGGING MINUTES!!! Still waiting!!!!

Lots of options, which is great, but they hand mix everything, so the top of my friend's tsoynami tasted like syrup. I had the German chocolate cake tsoynami and the s'more. Both were awesome, but I think the s'more an out.

Here is the deal with Nami. I like you, I do but you just aren't friendly.  I have been in there multiple times and I would love to buy multiple things but I feel like I am bothering all of you. 

Tonight I asked a question about ice cream.  I wanted enough to take home for me and my roommate to share AND have some for the weekend.  But you never let me get there and I ended up with a cup full of ice cream for just him.

My advice would be take the time to find out what someone wants completely before checking out of the conversation.  And don't look complete pissed when I ask you what something is. It makes me feel like I am bothering you and it makes you look like a jerk.

I will say if there was another place to go that had everything you did I would never go to you again until you changed your wicked ways.

I got a little confused because their sign is by a building the same color and on the door of the building it says Nami is next door. Other than that, I really liked the chocolate shake I got. It was very refreshing and not too sweet. A bit of an icey texture, which I liked. There were plenty of drinks I would like to try next, maybe the prickly pear tea or a steamer ( I don't drink coffee). The place was small, but comfortable with a good amount of seating. Lots of young people here. The parking lot was pretty small. Prices are a little above average. I wish the cashier would have bothered to tell me specials and whatnot because I was a bit at a loss of what to order.

A family favorite. Will continue to go back. The staff is always very generous and helpful. The food is fantastic. You would never know this is a vegan restaurant. I bring non-veg family here all the time and they always enjoy it and ask to meet there again. Absolutely lovely!

It was our last day in Phoenix and we were looking for someplace near ASU to get breakfast. This was fairly close so we stopped.The staff was friendly but the food at this restaurant was very strange. We ordered (what we thought were) egg plates but were apparently some type of tofu scramble. The food was fairly tasty, but overpriced for something that didn't even have meat in it. My daughter ordered a coffee that cost $5.25(!) which was so bad it was undrinkable. We will not be back.

I love their Sunday brunch. The burritos are super filling and just very yummy. I have a lot of food allergies and it's hard for me to find a place where I can really enjoy the food without suffering from it. This place just does that. Save some room for tsoynami or a donut!

I live in Portland but my family is in Phoenix, so I visit often. I absolutely love this place! It feels like I found a little bit of Portland there. The staff is super attentive and the food is so delicious. I love showing off how yummy vegan food can be to my family!

This place was so so so so great! We ate here for breakfast and also for dessert one night.
For breakfast hubby loved the biscuits and gravy and I LOVED the chilaquiles!!! So so great!
For dessert, we enjoyed the wonderful, amazing tsoynamis, which were indescribably delicious!
Food was ok, I didnt perticularly feel it was the best sushi in town but not bad. Waiters are gentle, the atmosphere seems nice and feels fresh.

Great coffee, delicious food and a wide variety to choose from at this sunny, cheery cafe. I'd definitely bring friends back here. The vegan breakfast menu includes pastries, bagels, biscuits and gravy, some breakfast burritos, yogurt parfait, pitaya purée with granola... I had a great kale salad with a citrusy chia seed dressing for breakfast. They also make specialty espresso drinks like the kick start (mocha with cayenne). Everyone was friendly, making it a nice overall experience.

Tsoynami! Oh Em Gee, delicious. 

Really good brunch on Sundays, with interesting and tasty specials (sweet cauliflower breakfast curry, what?!).

Pretty attentive and pleasant staff (lack of comma ambiguity).  

Can get crowded and loud indoors during peak brunch hours, but there's a significant amount of outdoor seating if the noise is bothersome. 

Also, multiple sriracha sightings. 

Sleep well knowing that although those doughnuts and tsoynami aren't helping your waistline, they also aren't directly supporting an industry of cruelty.

I'm not sure if I came in on a bad day, but we had horrible customer service from everyone who helped us except for the wonderfully kind guy on register this morning. I'm a vegan who lives in the area and was really excited to finally try this place, and I'm pretty disappointed that I didn't get the same cheerful service so many glowing reviews have mentioned. Having never been there before, we didn't know exactly how the service works, so when we'd received our entire order (including my coffee) but not my boyfriend's drink, we waited 5 minutes and then politely mentioned to a server that we were missing it. She literally said "okay?" (note the question mark) as she rolled her eyes and then never came back. My boyfriend and I just sort of stared at each other awestruck by how rude she was to us, and worst of all I think she may have been an owner or in management. As far as the food went, everything was really good! The biscuits and gravy were our mutual favorite, and everything came out of the kitchen so quickly that it made up for the 15 minutes we waited in line to order. I'm a coffee freak, and their cold brew was perfect. I wanted a to-go box for my donut and was too scared to ask for fear of being snapped at again by someone who clearly feels it isn't their job to help.. Overall, I do recommend this place to vegans and carnists alike, but with caution; expect yummy food but don't expect to be greeted when you walk in and don't expect to see any smiles.

Super fantastic vegan deserts and coffee! Handmade ice cream!  Donuts! Cupcakes!  Wow, so awesome!!!  Really a great place. And if you want food, go next door to Greens (restaurant owned by same people). Thank you so much for making my tummy happy :o)

Happened to be way up in Phoenix proper today and wanted to take advantage of some vegan grub. I selected this place at random and am so happy that I did. 

Great service. Pleasant atmosphere - on the student/hippy-ish/granola side of things - but that appeals to me. 

Had a great order of vegan biscuits and gravy that reminded me of home (in the South), just a whole lot more vegan!  Yay!

If you're in Phoenix you need to stop what you're doing and go to this amazing all vegan bakery and get a tsoynami (soy blizzard) treat. I recommend getting the mash where they mix in a mystery baked good item the best!

Never a negative experience! My favorites: the soynami, hazelnut lattes, the donuts, scones, cookies, & the nami mcbagel.  Awesome atmosphere, great location, lovely artwork, & super close to Green to catch dinner before.

Reviewing the coffee bar half of the Nami theme only...

Nami has been the closest espresso bar to my home since opening late last year.  Seeing as the coffee bean is a central part of my daily existence, it took me long enough to make my first visit.  Unfortunately, I would have been fine just delaying it indefinitely.  I can appreciate the whole vegan thing if that's their deal - there's a niche market for that and somebody's got to fill it.  What is astonishing is the refusal to placate the non-vegan crowd (i.e. overwhelming majority) and carry some half & half.   Introducing almond milk to whatever you're drink may be is an utter waste of espresso - trust me on this one.  The novelty of the concept, the trendy and energetic vibe, and the friendly baristas are among Nami's merits.  It's not the kind of coffee house that beckons you to sit down with a laptop or a book while you sip your favorite hot drink.  Hard, uncomfortable seats encourage you get what you came for and take it for the road.

This place is dangerous!  Cupcakes, cake, brownies, doughnuts, cookies... always an excellent variety of treats, and all very tasty.  

Also, Sunday brunch is not to be missed- I've never seen so many vegan breakfast options.  They also allow overflow seating next door at Green, so if the brunch crowd gets hectic, you will still have a nice casual dining experience.
Not really into the healthy scene so much but was pleasantly surprised when i tried nami. My family got the chick-o-stick soynami and was delicious.

I have suffered with Celiacs Disease for the last year. So it makes perfect sense to price gouge those in need, right?

$3.75 for one (1) gluten-free cookie. 'Nuff said.

Shame on you.

I was absolutely blown away by how good my dough boy tsoynami was! The restaurant  presentation is average at best but don't be fooled by that. This place is one of the best dessert venues in all of Phoenix!

I stop by Nami every single time I eat at Green next door. I have had about 5 of their baked goods. My favorite is the Lavender Cookies (light and yummy!) and my second favorite is their Pumpkin Pie (flaky and just enough sweetness). 

The ones I didn't like was the white chocolate Gluten Free Cookies because they were super hard and too sweet. The compost bar was suuuuuuper sweet. If you like sweet, than I recommend these, but it was too sweet for me. 

Of course the Tsoynami(s) are crazy good. Surprisingly, the peanut butter/chocolate is simple, but delish! I love the Almond Quixote! They are kind of big for me, so I always share with a friend. 

The most exciting part is that EVERYTHING is VEGAN! That is the best part since I am vegan. I am so happy that they opened this in Phoenix. 

The decor is super modern and neat. I love chillin' with my friends and hanging out here. I am going again soon!

Yum! Just finished off the Rocky Road tSoynami with pretzels instead of chocolate chips. It was magical. The pretzels remained crunchy till the very last bite.. Very exciting.


I love that the base is VEGAN and ORGANIC. Eating 16 ounces of ice cream never made me so happy!!!!

So many choices to choose from! A bit pricey but I would eat the soy soft serves everyday if I was closer. The cashier was extremely friendly and didn't mind that my friend and I stared at the menu for hours
Name has the dankest soft-serve soy ice cream! Sometimes there is a long wait for a Tsoynami, but it is worth it!

YUMMY!! As a lactose intolerant person this is my go-to place for ice cream cravings and milk shakes. Can't go wrong with the dough boy tsoynami! It may be a 15 minute drive from my house, but it is SO worth it. You will not be disappointed!
Mmmmmmmm, need I say more?  You had  The Hubs at "vegan blizzard" and did not disappoint.

A friend discovered Nami shortly after I assisted him in his transition to the plant based lifestyle. We originally referred to tsynami's as "sex in a cup", they are that good. Now that chocolate is offered, they are even better, if that is even possible. They always have gluten free options available and Sunday brunch is so filling and delicious. I am thrilled that breakfast is offered daily now as well. Coffee and dairy free milk selection is fantastic and staff is always friendly and inviting, often remembering me, even after long absences. I recommend this to anyone who is willing to explore plant based options. It is a great place for those transitioning or have an issue with dairy.

I'm not a vegan, I'm not a vegetarian. Who am I kidding, I go to filibertos five times a week and eat chicken nuggets every minute.
I tend to stay away from vegan/vegetarian food because its fake - meat like items and that makes me even more nervous than whatever saw dust that's in my chicken nuggets. HOWEVER, nami is GREAT. All their food was delicious and the BLIZZARD. DEAR GOD, THE BLIZZARD/ICECREAM. 
As a self-certified icecream expert, this is hands down, the best ice cream I have ever had in my entire life. That includes my travels in other countries, through different states, and raiding the entire freezer section of my local Fry's. The taste is great, the price is great, the texture is - wow, the texture is fantastic. I had my doubts but it was delicious. 
If it was closer to me I would buy it every day.

I was in Phoenix for just 2 days and managed to hit this spot up twice!!!! I really wish they had one in LA.

All vegan blizzards, tons of baked goods=my paradise!

My favorites were the Monsoon special (choc cake, choc chips, and choc syrup) which I added PB too and another one with pretzels, PB and chocolate chips.

Can't wait to come back on my next trip to Phoenix. They have a sister veg restaurant next door that I can't wait to try too (yes I may have just eaten Tsoynamis for dinner).

Came here on a whim on the way home from getting an early morning haircut. I was hungry, saw a coffee shop and pulled in. Had no idea it was a vegan coffee shop! The pastries looked amazing, and I got a vegan sausage breakfast burrito. Was awesome. I would recommend this place to all my friends, vegans and non-vegans alike
Great ice creams,great customer service.I would recommend this place highly,especially to anyone who is GF.

The Tsoynami was ruined me. FREAKIN RUINED ME. I don't like regular ice cream now. I felt refreshed after finishing the Dough Boy, which after eating non-vegan ice cream I wouldn't have. You can't even tell it's not ice cream except that it is more icy than milk and doesn't have the gross aftertaste. Drooling thinking of it right now...

As if the Tsoynami's weren't good enough, I tried brunch here for the first time this weekend and it was soooo good. I got the Benedict as a plate - tofu scramble, asparagus, tempeh bacon and hollandaise served over chibatta bread. I also got the Cactus Haboob Latte - agave and cinnamon infused and it was to die for. Vegan or not, go to this place! 

It fills up quick though, so get there early or expect a little wait!

I had only tried this place once but I plan to go back. The place is small but I like the decor.  The lady who helped me was nice. The tSoynami was amazing! I didn't think it was going to be that tasty but it was. Give it a try!

I'm not a vegan, and I LOVE THIS PLACE.  Everything I've gotten here has been great. During my most recent visit I got the "Mash Mystery," I have no idea what it was. But it was DAMN good. They also have coffee if your in the mood for that!

I'm always trying to find new places that offer vegan & gluten free bakery options and this place does not disappoint. I love that they make their own nut milks and the coffee was right on. Will definitely be back again and again!

We came here after years of seeing all of their great treats on social media. We were sorely disappointed when we arrived, and they only had a handful of options to choose from. We ended up with a cookies + cream cupcake and snickerdoodle cookie sandwich. Both were good, and we appreciated that the frosting in the cookie sandwich wasn't overly sweet. Hopefully they'll start sharing their daily offerings on social media so people don't waste time going there to find they are very limited in their options.
I had thee best vegan chocolate chip cookie dough icecream here!! The atmosphere is a unique mix of hip and relaxation. The staff is really friendly and I cant wait to go there again!
Best vegan ice cream. Love the chocolate clunky monkey. Usually busy. Nice outdoor seating available.

I was recently on a trip to Phoenix and we decided to check out nami for dessert after lunch next door at Green New American Vegetarian. We were a little too full for a tSoynami so we each had one blueberry fritter (large donut hole size). They were very good! We went and did some sightseeing and came back (only slightly shamefully) a couple hours later for tSoynamis. I had the Doughboy (vanilla soft serve, chocolate sauce, and cookie dough) and my companion had the Donatello (vanilla soft serve, caramel, chocolate sauce, chocolate chips, and pecans). These were like I remember Blizzards being! Soooo good. I haven't had anything like it since I became vegan 11 years ago. I would be in serious trouble if I lived in Phoenix since once upon on a time I had a serious Blizzard / DQ addiction. Please come to Portland, maybe? :)

I absolutely loved this little dessert shop!!! 
It had the cutest atmosphere and so many choices. The staff was very friendly and i was little confused when it came to ordering, but they were very helpful. I came with my closed minded non vegan family and they thought the desserts wouldn't taste good, but they were proved wrong! The chocolate raspberry case was sosososo delicious. We also got a few tsoynamis. The betterfinger, a chocolate one, and the mash up. I really enjoyed the mash up. The texture with the added baked good made it very fun. I've never been too big of a fan of soy Ice creams, but I really enjoyed this one! 
One thing that intrigued me that I didn't order was the orange juice with espresso. I've never even heard of anything of the sort end I definitely want to try it out sometime. I wish there was a location where I live in California!  I'm just going to make sure to stop by the next time I'm in Arizona :)

Pretty new at eating vegan and I've enjoyed looking for different places to eat. Had been looking forward to checking this place out. Walked in and stood there for a couple of minutes. Someone in front of me was being helped, but no one else working there acknowledged me at all. That's awful to not get any customer service at a place that I have been looking forward to going to. I would not recommend anyone to go here and that's just too bad. I wouldn't even give it one star, but I guess I have to.

Better come here ASAP if you are a Phoenician and vegan. Amazing selections and everything is vegan. All the soft serve soynamis are delicious and you have to try the house made vegan cream for the coffee. Would go every morning if could/lived closer. 5 stars.
Always amazing service and delicious selection of treats to fulfill your Vegan sweet tooth :D BEST Sticky Buns(cinnamon rolls) MUST try but they go quick so get there early! Enjoy

Nami has great donuts. They are like a cross between the cake donut and the more airy donut. They are chewy and more substantial than the airy-type donuts. The donuts are really delicious. The tsoynamis are always good. Their grits are cheesy (vegan cheesy) and come with half a roasted jalapeño on the top, so you can cut it up and spice up the dish, but the grits are one of the best things on the menu. I've always loved their spicy wings. I feel like they are still getting their feet wet on some other items, and hope they improve over time. The scramble, for instance, is somewhat dry and flavorless. The hash potatoes, which are usually a favorite of mine, are also somewhat dry and flavorless. If they could improve on those two things, I think it would be much better. They usually have a special each weekend. Get there right when they open if you want a big donut selection. The place is packed on Sundays!

I'm not vegan, but I brought some friends who were visiting and have recently become vegan.  They absolutely loved it.  There was a large group of us there for breakfast so we had the chance to try several different things.  Friends loved their biscuits and gravy and I liked my breakfast burrito, although next time I'll probably skip the melty vegan cheese.  Everything is vegan and they have gluten free options on top of that so I'll definitely be taking some family there when they come to visit (multiple allergies/food sensitivities).  Their donuts were light and fluffy, unlike other vegan pastries I've had.  Can't wait to come back to try some of their other desserts and coffee drinks.  The best surprise was the pitaya bowl.  The purée is so light and refreshing and goes well with the granola and fruit on top.  It was even better than the acai bowl another friend tried.  I don't know that I would go for any savory items again if I didn't have any vegans with me, but I'll definitely be back for coffee, dessert and pastries and probably the pitaya bowl!  We're also sad we missed the special brunch.  I guess they only serve that on certain days.  I would have liked to try their pancakes and French toast.

Delicous looking pastries, and pleasant atmosphere.  Its a great alternative to have.  I'm not the biggest sweet fan, and definately not sold on all the crap that goes into vegan foods and sweets, but if one must indulge then this ain't a bad way to go.  I love the location and how nice they keep it.  Its so much nicer thant he original Green.

Love love love Nami Sweets!!!! It's great that there are vegan options for people who eat a vegan diet and have a sweet tooth.  I have brought family members here who eat dairy, and they loved the vegan desserts just as much! Cant wait to go back :)

This is my new favorite spot! I can't have dairy and all other vegan ice creams I have had have been subpar, but this place is amazing!! I get the chunky monkey tsoynami  (banana and chocolate) with marshmallow fluff and even though I'm ridiculously picky, the staff are always so patient and accommodating! The last couple times I went I had the pleasure of Marissa helping me and she is just as sweet as the treats  I strongly recommend this place to everyone, vegan or not!

I have been to this place roughly 10 times now. My main server recognizes me now when I step in ther. We took a lot of friends with us and each time they loved it.
The restaurant itself is so nice and clean (up to the bathrooms that are spotless) and the ambiance is on the zen side with very neat decoration and wooden tables, Awsome.
Then comes the menu, We always went for the all you can eat menu and loved every roll we expeienced, It is of course on the "fusion" side of sushis, so you might found some strange combinations in one roll, but they are all surprisingly delicious and fresh.
There was one time we went there was a huge group comming for a birthday party (about 30 ppl) and it looked like a blast so I might think about it for a party someday.

All in all a 10/10 for me and my friends and family.

While visiting Phoenix we frequented this place many times. The bakery items were delicious but the biscuits and gravy are a must. The French toast was amazing as well as the breakfast wraps. The tofu scramble was pretty good but the potatoes were generic. The staff was always friendly. The prices are high but I've come to expect that at vegan restaurants.

Yeah!   Love this place!!  Went for coffee, nothing special an Americano...it was so creamy and delicious!  Wonder what they use for soy milk?  While I was there, directly after eating at green, I could not resist the soy soft serve tsunami...hope I'm spelling that right.  Chocolate and peanut butter with chocolate chips, so awesome!  Makes me want to move downtown so I can go to Nami at least once a day!

My favorite place to get cruelty-free pastries, donuts, soft serve ice cream, or any other yummy delight. Their Sunday brunch is to DIE for, and beats any non-vegan food in existence. I'm not exaggerating either, this place is a game-changer for everyone's taste buds. And not only that, the service is fantastic and the servers are always super friendly.

The cup size is wayyyy smaller now!..it was twice the size a few months ago...they don't fill it to the top all the way either. For $5.50 , i should atleast have it filled up all the way. Sure its delicious..but kinda a letdown. :/ i could get a larger amount for the same price at Loving Hut. The employees have a better attitude. Nami Lost our buisness

Loved this little place! A hidden gem for vegans and vegetarians! I went very early in the morning and had a small breakfast and coffee--everything was delicious and the service was excellent. I loved the atmosphere too! They were also listening to great music. It made my experience even better. The best part was how affordable it was! I was pleasantly surprised by this place and will definitely be coming back my next time in town.
Bomb @$$ breakfast burritos. Been there 3 times now and never been disappointed. I even have meat eaters I've taken with me who will tell you its absolutely delicious.

Holy yumminess!!!! Ok so I'm a meat eater, but prefer my veggies and this place would totally turn me into a vegan if I only knew how to make their dishes. We have been frequenting this place for Sunday brunch and working our way to sample the entire menu. My absolute fave is the sage sausage  hash as you can't even tell it's vegan and it is perfectly seasoned. Make sure you save room for the tsoynami. I am the biggest froyo fan but this tsoynami goodness has totally turned my world of icy food upside down. It's honestly the best frozen dessert I've had although I really have to slow down cause as healthy as it is being tofu/soy based all that extra sugar from all the toppings do not make it easier on this hip and I will still end up looking like a vegan fat whale.
I just discovered their AFFOGATO! It's divine! No, really. I have no words for how fantastic it is. I will never sleep again.
The ice cream is great, even though they have somehow defied logic and left out all dairy items. Bravo. I'll be back to this cool neighborhood spot.

I have been here twice once with a coworker that is Vegan and once with my wife. I haven't had a lot of vegan ice cream so I have nothing to compare it to but as soft serve ice cream it's so so not bad but not oh my good this is good. The cupcakes are really moist but for my taste the frosting is just a little to much. But that is just my taste if you like a big frosting this might be for you. Just and FYI if you have a low car it can be difficult to turn in and get out of the parking lot. But that has nothing to do with my rating.

Frittersssss are seriously addicting. We get coffee here almost every morning....and fritters every. morning. too...... staff is fun and friendly. Different artist work on the walls each month. Brunch! On Sunday's they have a special. Oh and can't forgets the vegan donuts and all the rest of the yummy desserts like Tsoynami! (Vegan ice cream)

Love everything about this place the ambiance, the staff, THE FOOD  
come early on Sunday's, though, things go fast. I Really wanted chulaquiles and a spinach quiche Sunday, it was about 12 and they were out! Other than that, love it.

On the same night my friend and I went to Green, we stopped here to get some vegan sweets.  We decided on cookies.  I think she ordered a snickerdoodle, and I ordered a chocolate chip cookie.  The cookies were good; however, it took a bit of time for us to get them.  They were right in the case, and I'd say we waited a good 10 minutes or so, and not sure why it took that long for us to receive them.

On my last day in Phoenix, we returned here to each try a tSoynami treat.  She had the banana cream pie flavor, and I ordered the PB and chocolate, and we were both LOVING our treats!  Very yummy and excellent to cool you down on a hot Arizona day!  Will also be back on my next trip.
Cool little spot.  Service was average, nothing spectacular.  We tried the Nami stuff. Different, but good.

I love Nami's "Cactus Haboob" latte, which has a yummy cinnamon agave flavoring that is perfect for my taste buds.  I also like the turkey melts, breakfast burritos, and huckleberry pancakes here.

The prices are pretty reasonable, the cafe itself is really cute, and the staff are very sweet.

This place is my saving grace. I can't eat dairy or gluten and this has an option for both! everything they have is vegan. Some things are gluten free. It's amazing. The staff is also super friendly. 
Parking is a bit weird, but not too terrible for a downtown area. I'll always come back to this place!

I was in Phoenix for work recently.  After picking up my rental car, I was in dire need for coffee.  I did a quick yelp search and decided to check out Nami, as it was somewhat on the route to my destination.  The barista greeted me when I walked in and was very friendly when letting me know all the milk alternative options.  I decided to be slightly adventurous and try coconut milk with my latte.  I'm not sure if I particularly liked coconut milk, but it was worth a try.

It was very hot and toasty in Phoenix and I ordered a hot coffee instead of an iced coffee.  Not sure why I didn't think to order an iced one...  despite the hot coffee on a very hot day, I still enjoyed it.  Thank Nami for providing me with caffeine :)
Variety of sweets, treats, coffees, ice creams, etc., and they're all VEGAN! Very friendly. Good vibe. They accept any and everyone into their facility :-) LGBTQ and straight people too lol

Had to write an update since they now serve brunch on Sundays.

I went in and was slightly disappointed to see that just about everything was with tofu scramble (not the hugest tofu fan), but I made a selection: The Benedict Arnold.  Made up of roasted asparagus, Canadian "bacon", "hollandaise", and scrambled tofu.  You can get it in a bowl (for the gluten-free kids), or wrapped in a tortilla.  I chose the tortilla, cause well...I love a damn good burrito!  

It came out, and I was ready.  First bite in, and I knew we had a winner!  The combination of all flavors was perfection to my taste buds.  They have a decent selection to choose from, including: cinnamon rolls, yogurt parfaits, other burrito or bowl delights, coffees and juices, and more.

It was a nice brunch experience and hope to come back for more.

Cannot say enough about this place. The Food is delicious and all dairy free. The staff is really nice and helpful. Did i mention that the food is delicous? Sunday brunch is a treat and they seem to be super busy. Go support local vegan business.

Yummy Nami! The tSoynami is so delicious here! I've tried quite a few of them, but Don Quixote is my favorite! My fiancé who is all about regular ice cream absolutely loves the dough boy tSoynami! I love the coffee & the cup cakes too! You won't be disappointed with whatever you try here. It's a small shop with scarce seating, but they have a few outdoor tables. The parking can be a tight squeeze and limited and the prices here can be pricey, but it's well worth it for a tasty treat!

The serving size for the "tsoynami" (soy soft serve blended with treats) was pretty generous!  Not Costco yogurt generous but still a nice large size for $4.50 before tax and tip.

I chose the mint Newman O one (don't recall the cutesy menu name).  It was really a lot better than I excepted.  It could've used another pump or two of mint syrup/flavor though, and the chocolate syrup tasted a little cheap (like Hershey's).

Pulling into the parking lot was not fun, but thankfully they weren't crowded and it wasn't rush hour yet!

Overall, a nice non-dairy alternative to the Blizzards and Concrete Mixers of the world.
Quick takeout service and the Oatmeal cream cookie was so much better than I expected. Made me realize I can eat plant based without giving up flavor.

I am such a huge fan!! I was in Phoenix for three nights.. and I came to Nami three times! If I lived in Phoenix, I would surely be a regular!

I twice stopped in for a tsoynami, which is the vegan answer to a blizzard. I tried the "Betterfinger" one night and the peanut butter and chocolate kind the second. Always they were delicious. I wish more places were doing this soy soft serve!

I also came for breakfast on a Saturday morning. I ordered a bagel sandwich with tofu, tempeh, and vegan cheese. It was really good, and it came with a side of fruit. The only critique would be that it took a really long time. But good things come to those who wait!

I also grabbed an apple fritter for my breakfast the next morning, as I had an early flight to catch and no time to find something vegan to eat downtown or at the airport. Even after surviving the night in my hotel's mini fridge, it was awesome.

Thumbs up all around for Nami!

It takes a great deal to push me to review an establishment, good or otherwise and I have written few. 
Whenever I'm in town, Green has been my standby for a couple of years now for its vegan selections, and this time around I took my family to Nami for the first time. For starters, my tea had finally come out with no almond milk. Easy fix. Didn't think anything of it. Brunch is a busy time for them and can understand that there are many chances for mistakes, however we noticed after a while that guests who ordered well after us were finishing their meals. We followed up and got an apology and we were fine with the explanation of their miscommunication within the kitchen. So to pass the time, I had ordered a mimosa from green and asked for different juice option. ($7 for a less than an 8oz mason jar). The lady misunderstood my order that I had already paid for and when I saw her finishing the pour of oj, I tried to explain that wasn't what I meant at all. Her reply "I already poured it." No matter that I already paid for it tho, right? She served the mimosa with a side cup and I asked her what that was for. She explained that the cup was for the juice order. Clearly another mix up and she refunded me for the juice. 20 min later, our food had finally arrived. I asked for the chiliquiles with no potatoes and it showed up loaded with potatoes. I pointed it out to our server, again, very apologetic and willing to correct it and add more scramble in place of. No problem there, except it came back with potatoes on it still. I had then asked to make a new one since their idea of a remedy was to simply remove the potatoes, and our server agreed to my request. The order came back with a hair on the plate and my moms fruit also had a hair. That said and also after tipping generously at the time of order, I decided to ask for a manager from Green. As it happens the cashier who took my mimosa order was the manager. I took her aside away from the table to explain our experience had been unusually below par and that I am a loyal customer. Her response was one that lacked empathy and not even made any kind of act or offer of righting the wrongs of the experience. And at that point, i knew what I had to do. Thank you for reading and I hope others get better service/treatment than we did. 

As for myself, my friends and family who I recommend, these two establishments has seen my last dime and now what was once a recommendation will now be a that of a warning.

VEGAN DONUTS.  Delicious, amazing, glorious VEGAN DONUTS.  WE went for the biscuits and gravy but when we saw these beautiful gems sitting in the case, beckoning us, it was all over.  We had a cinnamon donut.  So fresh, and springy and delightful.  It has been one of the only things I have craved but had been unable to satisfy since transitioning to vegan.  But now, finally, a fabulous solution.  

We also enjoyed the biscuits and gravy  and the mcbagel sandwich.  Both were extraordinary.  The B/G was huge.  Next time we will share.  Potatoes were cooked to a beautiful brown perfection.  The Tofu scramble is some of the best I have encountered but the star of the show, by far was the gravy.  Creamy and satisfying with large chunks of "chorizo".

The McBagel sandwich was also a thing of outstanding craftsmanship.  The bagel soft and delicious.  The tofu egg and veggie ham had perfect spice and flavoring.  I'm not sure how they make the "cheese" but it is AMAZING.  This little gem came with a side of fruit.  Boring and expected one may think.  However, this fruit was clearly freshly cut and perfectly ripe.  NO soft grapes, hard cantaloupe or honeydew here my friends.  This was beautiful, bite size chunks of granny smith apple, perfectly ripened strawberries and sweet pineapple.

My one complaint about NAMI.  I live in Mesa and it is in Phoenix.

I have driven by this place a million times but never stopped. Neither my husband or myself are vegan... but dairy sucks. Which makes eating ice cream really difficult... especially when you love ice cream. We just moved to the area and I really wanted ice cream, so we stopped here. The ice cream is delicious and lactose intolerant approved.

A vegan restaurant...the menu is limited and a little on the pricey side... but isn't everything else in the country?!    The faux eggs and sausage was surprisingly good!   If you don't want one of their drinks.. you can have water and ice in the back, near the kitchen area.   There's two restrooms outside, and they're very clean and modern.   Parking is very bad st this place... its like parking in an alleyway.   There wasn't any parking, so we parked in the restaurant a couple of doors down (no one ticketed us or put a warning, etc.   I'm sure they're use to it by now).
LOVE this place offers so many vegan options! Their stuff is delicious and they have great service 100%recommended.

How can you not like Nami? Delicious pastries, brunch, coffee, and killer service. Need I say more? I visit this place often and I love their yogurt parfait! Please go. Enjoy some sweets paired with a hot cup of coffee and take all your friends there.

Cannot say enough good things about this place! Customer service was outstanding! I wasn't sure what to get, so I asked the friendly girl behind the counter for her recommendation. She was very helpful and I ended up getting the cactus haboob latte with almond milk. It was phenomenal. Will definitely be returning here on my next trip to Phoenix!  Thanks for the great start to my morning, Nami. And a big thank you to the girl behind the counter that was kind enough to help me find the perfect drink on their menu!!

If your not a vegan definitely don't come come here. The soft serve tasted horrible, it tasted like ice with a hint of flavor. Also, the costumer service was horrible because there was a 30 min wait for the soft serve and the employees had a lot of sass for no reason. I was shocked I had a bad experience because a friend recommend it, but unfortunately it wasn't what I was expecting.

My family and I love this place! My daughter was just diagnosed with like 20 food allergies and this place was one of the only allergy friendly options I had to take her so she knew that there were still good food options out there. So important for a teenager to know!! And the food is yummy too!!

This is my first time here and my gf ordered the macadamia nut milk latte and the strawberry fritters. We loved it all. Even thinking about going back to grab more of the fritters and trying out their breakfast. It's hard to find a good vegan joint around phoenix. The search is over! Definitely will be coming back to try other stuff on the menu.
Hands down best ice cream in Phoenix. Creatively delicious vegan mixes that consist of classics as well as seasonal additions (Pumpkin pie mix is to die for). Always leaves your gut feeling good too!

Grits were excellent - spicy, cheesy (or well cheese-like) hominy chunks rather than instant packet grits. Servings are big for sides as well. I rather create my own meal of sides rather than an entree. As a vegetarian, I went between here and Green next door my whole Phoenix stay. 

The only thing that stuck out to me was when I ordered a pour over, before I even finished paying I received it. What? One of the main aspects of a pour over is that it's brewed fresh for you, cup by cup. Instead, I got coffee that was already made from a vat or percolator. It tasted rather watery and flavorless. More akin to diner coffee. Okay, maybe the pour over was pre-made and poured cup by cup into a giant vat. Who knows? That is more time consuming than what it's worth. Just sell drip coffee and call it drip coffee and charge less.

I doscovered the little gem in my search to find a new breakfast place. I was delighted to see such great reviews by other Yelpers.

I pulled onto the parking lot and was directed by an employee that the blue building is not Nami, but the one next door. Helpful as the two share a parking lot.

The inside of Nami is quaint with retro fruniture and art mixed in with little cacti in the windowsills and proud displays that they are open to all.

The menu stretches across the wall and features assorted coffee drinks, pastries and a lovely hot breakfast menu. From what I could tell, all of the items are organic.

I ordered a samoan but received a samoan bar instead of samoan donut instead. This was quickly remedied by the friendly cashier. The hot chocolate was also delightful with almond milk, my favorite.

They also had a small offering of other items such as boxed crackers, cookies, candy, etc.

Their restroom out back was decorated in a modern style.

The prices are comparable to the chain coffee shops and I would much rather shop local!

Love you Nami. A good collection of delicious house made vegan pastries. 
And the real reason we always came to Nami....... For the yummy Tsoynami's. 
Great list of choices for what you liked. And they are perfect size. Not too small and not too big. Last time i was at Nami they cost $5. But ive been told the price went up a little.  Ive looked and i cannot find any place here in Portland similar to Nami. I even got my meat eating, cow dairy loving friends hooked on the Tsoynami's. They would all finish the whole Tsoynami. Nothing left in the cup. (Lol) thats how darn good they are. And some times would go for a second one.  Great average sized seating area inside and patio seating out front or in the back.
We never got over there for breakfast but its some thing i wished i did. I usually went to Nami in the afternoon or at night.
If you ever think of branching out. Please come to Oregon Portland to be specific.

The long awaited, much anticipated CenPho brother to Green is HERE! 

While this isn't another Green location (don't worry! they will open soon!), Nami serves a huge menu of their delicious tsoynamis and a variety of other baked goods.  This little cafe is all vegan, and while my vegetarian diet allows me to overindulge in regular ice cream -  these tsoynamis could convert me. I had a flufflernutter (note: NOT a sexual term, but instead a mixture of peanut butter and marshmallow cream) tsoynami that was heavenly and huge. YUM!

I did not try any coffee but am very excited to. They offer soy, almond and rice milk - with promises to add more nut varieties soon. Nami offers a beautiful selection of pastries - cupcakes, whoopie pies, cookies.

The staff here was amazingly friendly and welcoming.  I felt like they genuinely cared about my business, as well as any comments or suggestions that we had.    

I am glad that I get to be the first review, since I was their FIRST customer. This vegan-niche is much needed in Central Phoenix and I am so stoked for what Nami and Green will bring to it!

Delicious treats, desserts, smoothies, coffees, and food! I found this place on Yelp and after finally deciding to try it out yesterday, I was amazed at how yummy my donut was! I came back today and got the Pitaya Power Breakfast. It is a must try. PLEASE OPEN A NAMI IN TUCSON!!!!!!

The best place for dietary restrictive date nights! If you don't have any dairy issues, you'll still love this place. Sooo good! 

Good things take time, so be prepared for your yummy to take a bit of time. It's made when you order.
The vegan Samoa bar was HUGE--enough for two people. Totally something to share! Nice ambience, too.

This place is really cool. It's vegan so it's nice since you don't get congested or anything because of the dairy. The ice cream tastes good and the cookie dough that they put in the dough boy is amazing! Its my favorite there. I could eat it alllll day. Only problem is that it's kinda hard to park since it's small. Usually you can find a spot though. It was packed today, but they were very fast with getting the orders out which was fantastic. I will definitely keep coming back.

Service was very kind and welcoming and that is the main reason I'm giving it 3 stars. The restaurant allows you to bring your own wine which is always a plus. When I had originally looked into this "all you can eat" both the website and reviews indicated 25$ but when I got there it was advertised outside and the menu's as 27.99$ which wasn't a big deal but I feel like they should have been consistent in advertising (I come from the westisland so I travelled pretty far). My favourite item on the menu was the Vietnamese soup. This is where they lost stars. If your a big sushi lover like myself, I do not recommend this place. The rolls consisted of too much rice and the fillings were mushy and spoiled. Also, the sushi rice was not anywhere near to being seasoned enough. The one thing that makes up a good roll of sushi is the rice ! Presentation was average. This resto is Vietnamese origin and I recommend only going for that time of food, not sushi all you can eat.

My rating is based solely off the German Chocolate cake I bought for my husbands birthday. It was super super sweet and the icing was very thick and tasted like store bought. Sadly, I was disappointed and would not go back for cakes. I might go back to try other things but, if the cake was any indication of the quality of other items I am leery.

I just got a cupcake so my rating is based solely on that.  For $4 you're expecting either it to be bigger or the flavor to be better. It is equal parts cupcake to frosting, stored in a fridge so it is cold and hard. Not fresh (which what do you expect when they don't specialize in just cupcakes) and icing was very hard and made cupcake impossible to eat and fell off. Okay flavor. Recommend trying another dessert.

I live in Portland, the apparent mecca of all things vegan. Surprisingly, there is one thing we don't have here that Phoenix does: the tsoynami.

"Isn't it just vegan soft serve?" you say. "Anyone can make that. You have that in Portland!"

Um, it's not just vegan soft serve! It's extra thick, extra creamy, not-too-sweet vegan soft serve. And then they put stuff in it! Completely different. It's basically a veganized Blizzard. Not only do they have the classic combinations you remember from the DQ (banana cream pie? with vegan nilla wafers?), but they have their own delightful and creative combinations. I'm kind of embarrassed by how many of these things I've eaten since I've spent a total of maybe three days in Phoenix, but my favorite combination is Cap'n Crunch Berries and strawberries. Maybe you're like me, and somehow the seemingly obvious combination of cereal and ice cream has eluded you until now. Well, go to nami and the nice folks there will set you straight about that.

The only thing I wish they would improve is the whipped cream. If, like me, you are not a fan of coconut, then it tastes overwhelmingly like coconut. I know some people like coconut, or don't think it clashes with whatever dessert they are eating, but I don't think the flavor of coconut belongs in my banana cream pie tsoynami, okay? I know, I sound ungrateful. However, it does not stop me from literally mandating that we stop and get tsoynamis every time we're in Phoenix. It shouldn't stop you, either! Just maybe order something without that.

all vegan dessert and pastry shop, my heaven!!! Love coming here for a treat, usually stick with ice cream but I've had their doughnuts and they are really good. Pretty small place but there is outdoor seating. It's a coffee shop set up and they do have coffee and drinks. It's kind of like a vegan version of Bosa (except they sell out of donuts really fast) with cookies, cake, and ice cream too. I believe this js their main tsoynami ice cream hub because I see more seasonal options at this location. Their weekend brunch menu is fantastic. They have a vegan quiche, burritos, french toast, biscuits and gravy. Tons of good eats all veganized and they really hit the spot, also love their seasonal options. Had a pumpkin cream filled donut with pecan toppings, so good! And it wasn't too much filling, they had a little  in the very center, it was perfect. My go too spot for vegan cravings (green has salads and grain bowls but it's not somewhere I come for something light/healthy. Definitely recommend for bringing non-veg friends who want to try veg food.

I didn't realize that Nami is the coffeehouse arm of Green. I came for breakfast (okay it might have been more like lunch) and was overwhelmed with the choice of baked goods. I got a pour over coffee (which I wasn't all that wowed by, but it was good), the huevos rancheros, and a blueberry fritter. 

I definitely didn't need all that food but I had to try it all. The blueberry fritter was awesome. Nami definitely does a great job with their vegan baked goods. The vegan huevos rancheros was an interesting take on the classic dish. It had hash browns, chili-spiced black beans, tofu, and some kind of mystery bean or protein that I couldn't figure out what it was.

Nevertheless it was all pretty good. Not to mention, the place was packed, which is always a good sign. However, don't go there on a weekend expecting to get a seat. Very limited seating and for all the people there, it was a slim chance. Especially with loners like me taking up a whole table.

This place is always my number 1 recommendation for brunch/breakfast in the Phoenix area. I've taken vegans, vegetarians, and omnivores and not once has anyone left less than amazed. The service is friendly and welcoming and the food always comes out quickly. Props to whoever selects the pastries and specials, they're always creative and delicious - captain crunch doughnuts, s'mores brownies, a different quiche per day, the list goes on. They also offer a wide selection of espresso drinks, milkshakes, and tsoynamis (vegan blizzards, essentially). 

No matter what you get here, you're going to be pleased. And don't think this place is only for vegans. Good food is good food regardless of meat/cheese/eggs/etc and this place always hits the spot.
SO GOOD. brought some treats back with me to california. :) the lavender cookies are yummy. and the dirty chai doughnut was phenomenal.

While you can find some of my favorites added to my post for Green I just tried an affogoto and I am hooked. I LOVE straight espresso so found myself eating spoon fulls of it straight but by the time i got to the bottom of my cup all that was left was tons of syrup. Next time I'll mix it all up and make myself a vegan flurry for sure. 

My friend Mariah works in here, if you see her or any of the staff you'll be greeted with a smile and the owners the man too. 

Definitely come in here for some vegan deliciousness but be ready for the post soy gas as well. 

Suggestions include peanutbutter chocolate bars, peanut butter frosted banana muffins, tsoynamis, and as stated above AFFOGOTOS! 

Oh one more tip, if you like chai get their desert haboob ;)

We decided to take a coffee break at this cute little place when we were visiting Phoenix and saw Michael U's review.

We had: espresso shake and pistachio donut. I must admin that I'm a fan of their creations.

The service I received here was very cold and unfriendly. I will never come back here again. 

My girlfriend and I came by here to get lunch at Green on Sunday 3-23-14 around 1:45ish. We went into green and asked if they were open. They said "not for another 15 minutes but food was ordered next door."  Ok no biggie. A sign would have been nice but whatever. We went to Nami where the person at the register (I really wish I got her name) gave me the worst experience. I was trying to find a lunch menu but was told "We are serving brunch right now but only for another 10 minutes." When I asked what they served in 10 minutes she said in an unfriendly tone, "we stop serving brunch. We are a coffee shop not a restaurant." 

After that we decided to leave and went across the street to Coronado café where we had a much better experience. (I will post a different review on that)

I'm not sure if all of their employees have this same attitude to would-be first time customers but customer service to me is very important for first impressions. 

This does make me sad since I was looking forward to trying something new.

Well, it's always my goal to try something different and that's definitely what Nami was! My boyfriend & I are by no means vegan, however we were in the area and he found this place under desserts on Yelp. We figured we'd stop in to give it a try. Was it good? .. By vegan standards, I think so? Would we return? Debatable.

The biggest problem we had at this place was that we didn't really understand what the menu items were. After a look over their offerings, I wanted just plain soft-serve, so I picked vanilla. Or more like "vanilla" I suppose. More than anything, it tasted super coconut-y. I'm not a fan of the coconut flavoring taste so that was disappointing as was the texture. It was almost just icy and not at all soft like what I'm used to. I did get used to it after a few bites but it almost felt like my teeth were hurting because the dessert was so cold!

My boyfriend was actually looking for a pastry and though the betterfinger would be tasty. A tsoy-nami is definitely not a pasty. It's more like what a concrete is from DQ for the non-vegan folk. I probably would have been better off ordering that since it actually had toppings to mask the flavor of the vanilla soft-serve. He also wasn't a fan of coconut taste but said that he didn't care for the texture more than anything else.

Like previously mentioned, I think by vegan standards, it was alright. Overpriced, however I've never had vegan ice-cream before. I suppose if I couldn't have regular milk, I'd probably come here to get a soy-based treat. The best part was that after eating my whole cup of soft-serve, I didn't feel like I had a sugar overload.

The staff was friendly but not very helpful. We saw a couple of customers there who seemed really annoyed, I'm guessing because they had to wait a while to get everything they had ordered. We didn't have to wait too long to get our order.

If you're in the area, check this place out. I'm interested in trying the vegan restaurant Green, which is right next to it.

Delicious, even as someone who is not a vegan.  The atmosphere is great and the coffee rivals some of the exclusively coffee-serving shops in Phoenix.  

That, and any place that serves tsoynamis are officially a favorite of mine.

This is the most overwhelming and beautiful place in the valley..it is definitely not for the indecisive. I am used to having a few vegan options at the average froyo shop or bakery, but here it is like vegan jesus created every amazing dessert in 7 days. 

The Mash is definitely the best and a gamble..so even better, especially because you can tell that the employees love making it and telling customers about it. I have never regretted ordering it. The only thing that you should worry about is spending too much because..it WILL happen.

ps bring some cash to tip with/ vote for your favorite theme of the day. its fun and the employees deserve a tip. when I was there it was zombies versus vampires and..being the walking dead fan that I am, it made it the easiest decision I had while I was there.

The gf is lactose intolerant, but LOVES ice cream. Major problem, until we discovered Nami. We love their tsoynamis! The soft serve is great and actually tastes like the real stuff. They have quite a few different flavor options with fresh and vegan toppings. They also sell coffee, tea, and vegan treats like pastries and donuts.

I like this place. My favorite is the oatmeal creme cookie when I can have it on rare occasions. Coffee is ok, but I see most people eating ice cream when I come for a visit. That said, please clean up the place between customers. Tables are always nasty and not wiped down after each customer. I have been in Nami dozens of times, but have never seen anyone cleaning tables.

Wut tha'.  All my friends (vegan/punx/activists/people who are 'conscientious') love Nami.  Yes, Tsoynami!  Uh huh.  So I took my kids there to see if it was the real deal.  My kids aren't vegans (that they've told me), so we were gonna figure it out.  

They loved it.  They even loved the atmosphere of the small establishment.  Kooky indie ambient sounds.  A girl with a bun atop her head but with a shaved head around the bottom.  High waisted shorts?  Yeah man.

But we got three Tsoynamis.  All different flavors.  They were like $4/5 each.  No biggie.  

I'll probably come back.

My friend was in need of a proper birthday cake from me, so a week later I suggested we get one from here cause the gluten free cupcakes are the best I've had. We ordered a gluten free strawberry blonde cake and they were able to ship it to the south Scottsdale/Tempe Green location to be picked up to save us driving time. She and her family thoroughly enjoyed the cake even though they weren't on a gluten and casein free diet like I am. I saved a slice for my bf and he nursed it for 20 min savouring each bite. I'm planning on getting him a horchata cake from here for his birthday.
Went in to get a gift card for some friends. Surprised to be charged a $5.00 fee to buy a gift card... I've never been charged to buy a gift card before. Sort of disappointing.

I LOVE Love this place!!! Super tasty and AAMmmmazing!!! 

Try the rocky road - walnut chunks with marshmallow fluff

almond joy tsoynami - loads of shredded coconut goodness

The only downfall was that one time their machine were down and they only had their baked goods available.
Been here a couple of times. Good coffee and food. Great HUGE oatmeal cookies. I would honestly come here for the cookies alone.

Employee with short brown bob cut styled hair who was working on 05/30/2018 on the close shift Is the reason for this bad review. I came in at 9:25 and asked if I could order one thing, they closed at 9:30. I understand that I came close to closing time but I drove 100mph on the I10 to get nami for my ill relative. And I called ahead and was told that they would take my order as long as it was before close. I'm extremely annoyed and disappointed with nami and their shitty employee especially since I drove 30 minutes from Scottsdale Road and the 101. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. The vegans should be ashamed!!! This is why I eat icecream that's has products in it that we're involved in extreme animal abuse because those icecream shops have never let me down.

Nami goodness for $5.  Chai tsunami, O ginger snap, rocky road and Coffee Coco Loco are all pretty phenomenal. Great for those that are lactose intolerant. Tastes light. These treats are tasty even when melted from the summer heat. Parking is limited.

It's really difficult to add anything original here because everyone else has already said it, but this place is simply amazing!  I have never tried anything here that I didn't like.  Their lattes especially are delicious.  The iced chai tastes very similar to Starbucks, for anyone who has become vegan and is no longer able to drink Starbucks chai because it has honey in it.  I also recommend the raspberry mocha.

All of their cupcakes and the McBagel and the burritos are great, too.

Just try the whole menu.  You won't regret it.

Very interesting place. Not at all what I was expecting. I had an iced mocha (geez was it vegan lol? Now I wonder!) which was pretty good.
