Only drawback was that there was a tiny layer of melted ice at the top which generally indicates the espresso was poured over the ice instead of the proper way of adding the ice last (which may or may not have happened since I wasn't watching it being made, just my observation after years of being a bit of a coffee snob). I also tried the winkie because it was too novel not to. It was... Hard to explain except although it bore no taste resemblance to its toxic namesake, I would definitely eat one again. Very enjoyable and baby loved it too. 

I can't give 5 stars simply because I think there are tastier coffee places in town (and whose beans I always buy a crapton of so I can pull shots at home), BUT nevertheless this was a great spot and I'm glad I finally tried it. If you're a diehard vegan this would probably be your favorite coffee place. 

Also - on a side note - they charge extra for whipped cream. Kinda weird. As a consumer, nickeling customers for those little extras is off putting. Psychologically, I would rather the prices were a touch higher and included the whipped cream. Just the way the consumer mind works lol.

Super good stuff! I just wish the wait wasn't as long as in was for just a frozen yogurt! The layout is very modern and clean but a little small for how much clientele they bring in. I'll be back only because it was so delicious. 

I changed my rating to five stars because on my most recent trip this morning. Not only was the food delicious and nutritious. It was an awesome service and all the staff were super fun and engaging even with how busy they were. Keep up the good work!!
Omg, the tsoynami (vegan soft serve ice cream with various toppings) is incredible! Fantastic and friendly service. Right next door to Green.

If you're looking for a vegan, gluten free cake for a special occasion, this place is tops in terms of flavor. I got my husband a peanut butter chocolate cake for his birthday, and it was fantastic. I've never had such a good gluten free cake before. What marred the experience was that my cake was damaged by the cashier when she put the lid down. They took it next door to the bakery to fix it, but it was still visibly damaged. I did contact the store to let them know of the incident, and they gave me a small gift card to make up for it. 

I returned a few days later to share some breakfast burritos with my mom and sister. I had heard about the wholly k-aioli on instagram, and I was dying to try it. It ended up being a kale overdose wrapped in a tortilla, but I loved the big ole breakfast burrito that my sister got. She switched me because she's cool like that. 

There are many more offerings, especially for brunch, that I have yet to try. Nami/Green knows how to do vegan junk food!
I liked their coffee, and they had a really really nice and clean bathroom, which I really appreciated after eggs benedict.

So, apparently, when I've been here in the past and ordered a macchiato, I was given a CARAMEL macchiato. Which I did not order, but did enjoy. I was under the impression that their macchiato had a bit of caramel drizzled in it. WRONG! Tonight, I ordered a "macchiato, 16oz please" and was informed that it only comes in one size. Previously, more than once, I've ordered a 16 oz macchiato and I explained that to the gal tonight. She asked someone else there, who confirmed they only make it in one size. Ok, fine, I'll have the one size and please make two since I will want more than 12 oz. Then I stood there for 20 minutes, while they made every other customers' tsoynami's, even those who paid after me. I understand, they were busy, but it's just a coffee now.... The gal who rang me up, finally noticed me standing there and apologized, saying they would make my macchiato's right away. Which they did. I get back to work and take the lids off, and they aren't even filled up all the way. What the heck?! Upon sipping, it definitely is NOT the same thing I've received in the past when ordering JUST a macchiato. I never once have ordered it as a caramel macchiato, but I'm realizing now, that must have been what I was charged for, and what was made for me. Moral of my review... get it together guys. I love your products, and you are full of super nice employee's, but there needs to be a bit better communication between each of you, especially when busy, so that a coffee order isn't waiting for 20 minutes. And PLEASE instruct the sweet guy with longer brown hair and glasses, that when a customer orders a macchiato, it only comes in ONE size, and it's not the same thing as a caramel macchiato. ;-)
Their coffee and donuts are soooo bad, but sooooooo good....
Excellent baked goods ... couldn't tell the difference that they were vegan. So moist and tasty. Definitely recommmend...  I'll definitely be back to try other things - it is a bit pricey tho.

I really enjoy the food over at Nami and appreciate the variety of all vegan items. With that being said I still decided to give 2 stars because of my last visit. If I come in before 10:30am but end up in the front of the line ordering after 10:30am, it doesn't seem fair that "breakfast will no longer be served" no matter how long I waited or taken into consideration when I actually stepped in the door. Staff was not friendly or accommodating. There was a whole line of people behind me also hoping to get food that were also told they couldn't order breakfast. Seems like Nami is just turning away money. It would make more sense to end breakfast at 11am so that people can walk over to Green but instead there's an awkward 30 minute gap until Green opens so I just decided to leave and get food elsewhere. Disappointed with my last visit and this is the second time this has happened. Can't say I'll be coming back anytime soon.

tsoynamis are the BEST! I'm not even vegan but I crave tsoynamis! instant favorite. cute place with art on the walls. cool place to meet friends, go after dinner. wish it was open a little later though.

VEGAN SOFT SERVE!!!

I was recently in Phoenix for a concert, and had a day to kill, so I searched around for good vegan spots in Phoenix.  Nami did not disappoint!

I had a Tsoynami, and a cupcake.  Man, the cupcakes look small, but they're sooooo rich!  Filling and delicious!  I couldn't even finish it all in one sitting!

The soft serve is so good and so unique to this location I keep finding myself searching for excuses to visit Phoenix.  I'll be back, for more Tsoynami!

We just had dinner here for the first time last night with our 2.5 year old toddler. I'm guessing it was pretty empty because this place is pretty new. 

We went for the all you can eat option, which is roughly $24.00 per person, and free for kids under 3 years old. 

The fantastic thing about the all you can eat menu is that all roll orders are 2 pieces, which is fantastic because then you really can try almost all the different rolls on their menu (which is a lot) they are very creative, and the list of rolls seems endless. Fantastic rolls!

I love sashimi, and this is where they lose a star. The sashimi options are very very limited. I think it was only 6 or 7 choices, and I didn't love the sashimi I did get. 

The desserts are fabulous. We had the dessert rolls (mango, strawberry chocolate etc) and they were great. We also had the deep fried banana and ice cream, which we devoured. 

My favourite thing about this restaurant by far is our server Edith. She was quick, prompt and our water glasses were always full. She was friendly and absolutely amazing with my daughter. She spoke both french and English and was just altogether fantastic. I wish she was my server at every restaurant we ever went to.

Delicious delicious delicious! We always get the chocolate Rocky Road blend and it's amazing each time! It's so nice and creamy we often split 1 cup between 2 people and it's a perfect dessert! We always come here because this is one of the only places in the Valley which serves vegan icecream which tastes like real icecream.

Went here for a little #SundayFunday aka cheat day indulgence... I had the Nami Cakes and I must say it was alright! Nothing spectacular, personally I feel like this place was over rated and and DEFINITELY over priced!!! I paid $4 for a little ass cupcake... Literally it wasn't even a regular sized cupcake! Highly disappointed, much rather would've spent less money for an extra 50 calories!!!!

Only 10 min away from walking distant.
This is really really really good, also really really really bad.

I am almost finished with trying each soynami.... So far and not a fan of the one with banana.
YET EVERYTHING is.... just... just good. Place me on top of a Swiss alp let me sing, dance, and exclaiming goodness oozing. 

Also i can eat one and not feel lik I am creating havoc for my metabolism to compensate.

RL:

NOTE: Oddly takes an unusually amount of time to get into my hands. 10min?
Worth the wait, worth the walk, worth the extra chocolate ;)

I came here when I was in Phoenix after eating at the vegan restaurant next store. They have a large variety of vegan pastries, many of which are gluten free, and vegan ice cream. I got three pastries, the strawberry cupcake (which I believe was gluten free), the yankee doodle (also gluten free I believe) and the chocolate, berry croissant. The strawberry cupcake was okay but the other two were amazing! The cake was kind of dense in the cupcake but I did enjoy the frosting and the fresh strawberry on top. The yankee doodle was 2 snickerdoodle cookies with frosting in the middle. It was amazing, one of the best vegan, gluten-free treats I've had. The cookies were moist and flavorful and the frosting sweet and delicious. The chocolate, berry croissant was excellent too. The croissant itself was good, but not quite as buttery and rich as a non-vegan one. The chocolate was more of a chocolate mousse and had very good texture and wasn't too sweet. It was also topped with some yummy fresh berries. I'm gonna try the ice cream next time I'm in Phoenix.

The tsoynami was okay, but seemed overpriced for essentially the equivalent of your local DQ treat. Didn't try the coffee. The actually space is very small and not much of a coffee shop vibe (would not recommend for studying).

Tried their chai tiramisu. It was overwhelmingly sweet for me. However, I liked that the ice cream is soy base and you can add whatever toppings you wish. I also ordered the almond latte and my hubby had the chai tea latte. Again, his drink was really sweet but mine was just right. 

I would come back again and try other kind of "tsoynami" and get my almond latte drink!

I came here looking to try some new vegan options in my life. Thinking at the very least it would help my hangover. What i found was more than i could have imagined.

A unique venue with two buildings one housing a cafe-esque ordering are and the other the kitchen with enclosed dinning that allows just enough of the outside in to be pleasant. The staff was courteous and attentive. The options numerous and bounding with eccentric platters. 

Moving along, the important thing here is FOOD people , and it was amazing. While most things seem to mimic meat dishes with chorizo and eggs on the menu, Nami pulls of these imitations by making insanely more delicious vegan plates.

I was blown away by my "Chicken wings" the sauce was unlike anything i have had before and i was instantly in love. My OJ based concoction was also amazing as it had some kind of red syrup in the bottom that complimented the not too sweet OJ. 

Street pedestrians are not disruptive to your dinning experience and provides ample opportunity to people watch. 

All in all this place is a must go location if your trying for a healthy, creative, and delicious meal in Phoenix.

Ok. Since I've become completely and totally addicted to tsoynamis, it's only fair that I update my review. At least once a week I find myself craving a tsoynami. Even my boyfriend, who is adamantly against vegan and soy products, has fallen in love with the tsoynamis and often accompanies me on my trips to get them. These desserts are also HUGE. For $4.50, you can easily split it between two people. I usually like to eat my own so I can bask in my gluttonous glory. All of the baked goods are also excellent. I have not been disappointed by anything I've had here. I've been converted to a Nami believer!

Dairy-free soft serve?? Prayers answered!! Cute little place offering all vegan treats. Only had the ice cream and would go back for just that.  So good. Choco, vanilla and swirl...milkshakes, etc... pastries and what looks like a tasty brunch. Nice to order from a menu and not have to worry about 'the allergy' - super annoying dairy allergy... so happy to have found this.

For not being a dessert guy and a huge meat guy (could never understand this veggie vegan thing) Nami had some darn good desserts that weren't over sweet and had flavors that I don't normally taste in desserts.

Had a coffee and the donuts (vegan ones at that) and the fiancé ordered some chocolate cookie.  Actually for something very simply prepared the taste was really good.

The coffee tasted spot on with a good balance of bitterness and smoothness (put 2 sugars and just a splash of what I assume was cream)

So if your vegetarian or want a dessert that doesn't overload you with processed sugars, hydrogenated oils and other crap that is in most bulk desserts, check this place out.
MY FAVORITE!! The tsoynamis are to d i e for...I went two days in a row! The carrot cake was delightful as well, there are plenty of dessert options. I'd recommend to everyone!! This is vegan heaven.

Their gluten-free vegan doughnut was out of this world good. However they have no decaf coffee options even for an Americano which sucks for me because I can't drink caffeinated coffee, so that is the only reason I took a star off and it would've only been a half star if that was possible. Service was great and friendly and the place is small and quaint.

I bought two items here, a slice of the Pistachio Rose Cake and a Coffee Cake donut. The cake slice was moist and baked well, also frosted beautifully, I thought for the amount the price was reasonable. I bought it for lunch and I was full! I bought a coworker the Coffee Cake donut and she liked it. The parking situation is tight and small so be careful and you can only enter on the South side of the building and you exit on the North side.
A great place for vegan desserts and other novelties. My non-vegan kids love their tsoynamis particularly the cookie dough infused Dough Boy.
A little overrated. Good tasting, but nothing out of this world. Unique in its being vegan.

Today is my second day in row coming here for breakfast. Yesterday, I ordered the Nami McBagel Breakfast Sandwich and the Matcha Green Tea Latte. The breakfast sandwich was crazy good! I'm not a vegan so I was a little skeptical of the tofu egg, "bacon" and "cheese", but it was absolutely delicious! There is also a sauce that is a little spicy which completes this sandwich. I also love that they use real matcha as many places don't and I can get  it unsweetened, which a lot of people think is crazy.

The only downfall is the cost. It's $16.83 for a breakfast sandwich and latte. To me, that's a bit expensive. This is a place I'll come back to splurge every now and again, though. The food and I cannot forget the service is that good!

Highly recommend!
I have myself believing that a tsoynami is not bad for me. Please do not feel obligated to comment otherwise. Anybody. Thanks.

I think ice cream is pretty disastrous, so when I tried the tsoynami, I was in frozen dessert heaven.  I've only tried the fruit blend versions, and crave them regularly.  They're good.  And they're big.  My daughter and I are easily satisfied sharing one.

I'm not a coffee drinker, but do enjoy a good chai latte now and then.  This, by far, is the best chai latte in town.  It's got a fairly descent spice (and I love the spice), and I can actually taste the ginger.  And of course, no dairy.

On the down side, my mom loves her dose of half n half in her coffee.  The non-dairy options just didn't satisfy her one bit.  I would imagine that most of my dairy loving friends might be reluctant to join me there.  Oh well.

P.S. Thanks for the doggie-patio love.  She loves riding over with me.

I came here with my girlfriend and we ordered a big size iced mocha only to be disappointed. The cup size itself is very small compared to the price I paid. The cup was also filled with ice which made the quantity of the drink even smaller. Hoping to maybe get a possible refill due to over amount of ice, the employee told me that that was there usual quantity. The drink tasted fine, but for the price it is extremely over priced. It's hard to see myself comeback here.

I decided to try this place while I was visiting Phoenix since all the Yelp reviews gave them 5 stars! I can see why!!!! I had asked the cashier to recommend me a flavor for their T'soynami, as I have never heard of anything like this before. She suggested the vegan nami. I was unsure at first because I am by far not even close to a vegan... more like a carnivore! I went with her suggestion anyway. The vegan nami is so delicious! I would go back there again and again if I am ever in town again! Vacationing and decided to stop here to kill time because of the rave reviews! I'm so glad I did!!!

Went in there today for the hundredth time. I ordered a cupcake that is the vegan equivalent of a chocolate hostess cupcake. Amazing! They also have great coffee drinks, other pastries and vegan blizzards. Yum! On the occasional Sunday I will take friends to their brunch.

Amazing vegan sweets! Love their Sunday brunch! Highly recommend.  

Note: it does get loud and overrun by hipsters, but the food is still well worth it.

This is the best place to grab something healthy & sweet! The best part is that it's all vegan! I'm vegetarian and hope to one day become vegan. Nami, you make that dream seem a bit more achievable since everything is so good!

If you want a creative, delicious, thoughtful, good for the earth meal VISIT NAMI!!! We are frequent visitors (about once a week, usually Sunday brunch) and every visit has been memorable. We have ordered the biscuits and gravy, the big ol burrito, the donuts, the cupcakes, the Benedict as a burrito, and the Rodney Dangerfield. Even with a line out the door service is fast, and friendly! 

The restaurant itself is small and intimate. They have indoor and outdoor seating and during brunch seat next door at Green. 

The pastry case is always full of delicious, colorful, and (of course) always vegan treats. You won't be able to help yourself but to order one (or 5). 
The donuts are dense and sweet and always come in creative flavors that put any other donut (vegan or not) to shame. 

You DO NOT HAVE TO BE VEGAN to eat here. I promise that the food you enjoy at Nami is tastier and better for you and your environment than you can get at any other restaurant.

My husband and I had lunch at Green at some point during Thanksgiving week, which is next door to Nami. We had such a terrible experience at Green, that we were hesitant to go over to Nami (I believe they're owned by the same people). Read through Nami's reviews, and decided to take the plunge anyway.

No regrets at all! It was such a relief, the two ladies working that day were so nice and accommodating. They took the time to explain their tSoynami menu to us, and they didn't rush us.
I ordered the Chai tSoynami, and I believe my husband got the cookies and cream one. We loved it! Portions are huge, but we licked up every last bit. 

I knocked of a star because they are pretty vague about what they put in their tSoynami's. Some of the items seemed too good to be true. Would be nice if they listed detailed ingredients on their menu, since a lot of commercialized "vegan" foods tend to be highly processed and, sadly, unhealthier versions of what they imitate. 

Anyhow, we were visiting from LA, and I really wanted to stop by again before we left but we never got to! So sad! Anyway, we're excited to go back next Thanksgiving! 

Thanks Nami !

Nami is great.  I went there twice during a recent trip to Arizona and would have returned if I was there longer.  It was so difficult to decide which tsoynami to order, as they all sounded amazing.  I ended up trying the Rocky Road and the Fluffernutterin'.  Both were delicious.  My only (small) complaint was that the soft serve was a bit icy.  I also tried a couple of their baked good (wish I could have tried more) and was very happy with both - the cookie dough cupcake and the cookie layer cake.  Both were moist and chocolatey with amazing frosting.  If you are vegan in the Phoenix area, go to Nami!
Great place for that sweet craving . Great environment . I would suggest adding more staff for help being this is such a busy place . Parking isn't convenient

This is an adorable shop with an awesome vibe. The coffee and soft serve is all delicious and I cannot say enough about the food! I got a McBagel and my boyfriend got biscuits and gravy. We shared each other's because we couldn't decide which we liked more! And then I got a Samoan (like the Girl Scout cookie but in large bar form) to go. Go here, get everything, you won't be disappointed!

Nami makes incredible food and sweets! I am originally from the Bay Area and I will be so sad to move back after school simply because there is no Nami back home. They're my go to place for vegan breakfast/brunch and I would recommend them to EVERYONE

Great little coffee stop with delicious vegan pastries.
Staff were friendly and atmosphere was laid back.

Awesome vegan goodies that taste as good as the "real" (i.e., "conventional") thing.  Service has always been very friendly and the establishment is immaculate.  The tsoynamis (think healthier version of McBlizzards and yes, that is the correct spelling) are so good; on my most recent visit, I got the Dough Boy, which was chock full of chocolate chip cookie dough.  I also bought a maple glazed doughnut (I would eat the glaze by the spoonful!) which was consumed far, far too quickly.  On another recent visit, I enjoyed an oatmeal creme pie (a sandwich cookie with yummy buttercream) and a chocolate cake doughnut.  Everything I've ever had from Nami has been fresh and fantastic.  Bonus: I can tell myself that everything I eat here is healthy and good for you, because VEGAN.  ;)

Haven't been here in awhile, cause I drive from the far East Valley.  Used to be my go to when I was on this side of town and would normally have good service.  Unfortunately today was not a good experience. We ordered two coffees and two doughnuts, simple order. I waited forever to get my order. Everyone behind me in line that ordered, got theirs and left. I noticed they made all the Tsoynamis all at once, no matter what time you ordered them. Leaving all the simple orders at the end, even though I was first to order. I had to ask if they forgot me, since I was the last man standing. They said no, we're making your drinks now. They asked if I already got my pastries, I told them that I haven't received anything from them and I waited the longest.
Not one sorry...no apologies, nada. Where has the customer service gone.... As business owners I understand that you're only as good as your product and especially customer service. Unfortunately they failed in customer service today. I believe their system is flawed, hopefully they're having an off day. One customer told me that this was the longest wait he's ever experienced and he had just ordered a simple plain iced coffee, he got his order right before mine, after he had to remind them of it. Was going to give them 2 stars for today's experience, but thought that may be a bit harsh.
Was pleasantly surprised with the PB&J tSoynami. Never had tried Vegan soft serve... I would get this again though

Great product.  Hate the wait. Never less than 20 min for a to go order. 

Next visit, called the order in, no change. Still had the wait. Maybe a separate line for pick ups?  The indifference of the "Cenpho hipsters" working the counter is old & tired.  Really, really great product though & I will continue to patronize despite the pain of the visit.

I only have one complaint about nami. If you order brunch togo, they have no system to handle it and you can end up waiting in line for your pick up for about 10 minutes. Other than that, everything is phenomenal. Their pastries, great. Their coffee bar, great. The soy-namis, are a vegan blizzard alternative that are way better imo. If you are vegan or vegetarian this is a must, and soon to be your regular spot. Please come up with a system to continually call out for your to go people though, thanks!

Vegan blizzards! Their tsyonamis are consistently good and you won't miss the dairy. I especially enjoy the cookie dough one, so much that I haven't tried too many others. The staff is always friendly and they even offered to split our tsyonami so my husband and I could share.

I'm a three or four per week Tsoynami addict. PB&C, cookies and cream and dougboy are personal favorites. Also try a slice of Vegan cake. Only non-dairy dessert I've found that's as good as a Tsoynami is in Tel Aviv!!

Call before you come to get donuts. The open at 7 but no donuts were ready and I had to wait 40 mins. Nothing was compensated for my time. I set my alarm just to get up early to be here to send them to someone in Cali. I was a little salty. I could have stayed in the bed. At least they were good.

I just came for the ice cream! Let me tell ya, great ice cream. It appears to be "just soft serve", but they take it to a new level. I got rocky road and it was bomb. I'm anxious to try the peanut butter next time. 

I am so happy to have this place just a bike ride away from my home.

one of my favorite places to dine - - - - finally tried breakfast - had biscuits and gravy - - - I've had tufu scramble before, but this one was very dry and tasteless ..grave had great tast, but needed to cover dry biscuits - - - good health should also be tasteful - - - but I still love them

Met 3 friends here for what I thought was supposed to be coffee but turned out it was supposed to be lunch. Fitting that I came in confused, because the menu here is the most confusing I've ever seen. Chalkboard, display items, a few specials hand written on signs, and a print menu hidden behind the cash register so we didn't find it until we had waited in line and tried to make our choices from the scribbled notes. They would do well to have one readily available printed menu with all offerings. So we had 2 GF folks and they got the zebra donut and loved it. I got a bagel with herb cream cheese and it was yum. Later we saw the table next to us eating grits and it looked so good we ordered one to share. Very tasty and filling.
Great for those who are lactose intolerant. Delicious ice cream with many options. I wish they had more locations

Stopped in for a quick latte + work session and Nami turned out to be a great choice. Delicious iced latte served up by a friendly team in a cute shop. 

I may have missed an opportunity by not trying one of their desserts while I was there. It seemed as if every other patron was stopping by for some ice-cream-in-a-cup-with-stuff-on-it gloriousness, but I stuck it out with coffee. Sigh. At least the coffee was on point.

Good burritos, good coffee and bomb donuts. The wait was a little bit longer than anticipated,but nonetheless great place to stop.  We will definitely be stopping by again when we're traveling through Phoenix!
I drive over 30min to come here. It's so worth it' The best vegan cookie dough ice cream!
This place is so yummy! Everything is fresh and has a lot of flavor! I'm in sweet heaven. Definitely place I'll be coming back to on my cheat days..

I wish my recent business trip to Phoenix had been longer as I'd have had the opportunity to make more than one visit to Nami.  I arrived near closing time, after dining at Green, and picked up a couple of truffles.  They rocked my world.  I will definitely be back the next time I am in Phoenix.

Best soft serve I've ever had and practically guilt free since it's soy based. It has the consistency and satisfaction of ice cream. The size is also very generous, meaning more for me! Really, how much better can it get? I have no complaints.

Met the owner, Damon, while I was there. What a down to earth and cool guy.

Please come to LA! We need you!
I've been coming here for almost a year. I'd say this is EXACTLY vegans version of McDonald's.

I have been here 6 times now and on a full half of the occasions I waited in line and was told that they would not serve me. "We closed the register" is what they consistently say, though the doors remain open. Call it what you will, but at the least it's really bad customer service.
Stopped by to try the tsoynamis and it was great until I got half way through and found a small hair in it! Grossed me out!!!

YUM! YUM! YUM!
Amazing healthy choices for those that care.
Rare selections of ice cream, fro-yo, coffee, teas, and more.
A true treat! Enjoy.
The Samoa pastry was delicious. The ice cream was also pretty good but would definitely recommend the pastries if you haven't had them before.
I'm not a vegan, but I went with a vegan friend to Nami. Boy was it delicious! I had their quiche, and I have to say it was the best quiche I've ever had.

I ordered a tSoynami and really enjoyed it. They have a great selection of creations that you can order from. The only problem I run into here is that this place can be tight squeeze and your order can take awhile on busy nights.

Nami recently did our wedding cake and a variety of pies for our April 2013 wedding. We had a carrot cake with cream cheese frosting for our cake and 10 fruit/pecan pies. They were all amazing! We had 65 people at our wedding and didn't tell anyone they were vegan. No one would had known otherwise. My husband's mother, who is an amazing cook herself and doesn't dole out compliments lightly, said it was the best pecan pie she had ever had. We did not have many leftovers at the dessert table to say the least. A big thank you to Nami!

Come for breakfast, but come back for the desserts.  A co-worker of mine and her husband are steadfast vegetarians and fell in love with this place almost as fast as they fell in love with Green next door.  This place is owned and run by the same owners as Green, and the space is small just like its counterpart.  Whereas Green is more of a lunch and dinner spot, Nami is more of a breakfast/dessert spot.  We got here around 10am on a Saturday morning and by the time we sat down, it was packed.  Not surprising given how many vegans and vegetarians live around Downtown.

My co-worker recommended I get the biscuits and gravy.  I saw a couple of cupcakes that caught my eye in the pastry case (cookie dough cupcake and red velvet cupcake) so I got those and an OJ too.  As with Green, you order at the counter and seat yourselves.  Total for all of my food was $20.  Food came out to us in less than 10 minutes.  Let me first go into the cupcakes.  I've had vegan cupcakes before at Treehouse Bakery just west of here, and these were equally delicious.  The frosting on both was dense, but creamy and decadent.  The cake itself was actually more dense than Treehouse's which made eating two pretty tough, but it was worth it.  As for the biscuits and gravy, I actually loved the tofu eggs as they put enough spice and herbs on those to make me forget I was eating tofu.  It didn't have the texture of an egg at all, but it was still great.  The home fries were also tasty and crispy and light.  As for the biscuits and gravy itself, mixed reactions on this one.  There was a lot of onion on my gravy which seemed to be a little bit of overkill.  The biscuits were also a little dry.  It was okay, but I think Bragg's Diner (also just west of here) does the vegan biscuits and gravy thing a little better.

All in all though, I was pleased with my first trip here.  The vibe is super relaxed, the gals behind the counter are super friendly, and the portions of food on every dish I saw were plenty hearty.  Even though the food is all vegan, I can assure you that no one leaves here hungry.  I can't totally recommend the biscuits and gravy for breakfast, but I fully intend to explore other breakfast menu items in the future.  I've also heard a lot of good things about the tsoynamis, so that'll be on my to do list.  Just be warned, once you take one look at that pastry display case, its pretty much impossible not to order one.
Tsoynamis are amazeballs- even if you are accustomed to good old, fully-leaded ice cream treats! :)
Damn....  Just go there, go there now!!  I had the breakfast burrito, amazing!!  Got to chat with some of the staff members, everybody was super nice.

Pleasantly surprising.  They serve Royal (@ the Market), for those interested.

Being pretty hip to the coffee scene in PHX, I was a little surprised to hear of this new shop, having not heard of it's coming.  Maybe I didn't look around enough, but it felt like Nami just kind of popped up.

So I had my doubts, as I always will when giving a new place a shot.  The layout was pleasant, and the decor pretty rad; love the couch.  Parking seems sorted out a great deal better than when That's A Wrap inhabited the area -  good plus there.  Sweets looked great.

So I order my typical - drip and a 2x (on the side).  This gives me a general idea of the shop; milk drinks are for second and beyond trips.  Firstly, their demi-tasses are super cute.  Obviously hand-made, and hopefully local.  Loved it.  My drip actually turned out to be a pour-over, which is a plus to me.  A coffee junkie can appreciate a pour-over, where it kind of scares a person just wanting some "coffee" (see: I understand why you call it drip vs pour-over).

Straight up espresso is generally a quick way of determining bad-average-good.  Crema was nice though, consistent, and had me thinking I might have a decent thing here.  Taste was good, creamy and quite chocolatey (which seems the profile of the beans being used - the drip was reminiscent of the same).  Said and done (from a 'snob' standpoint), the espresso was good, not mindblowing.  I think the grind was right, but either the dosing could be moved up a tiny bit, or tamped a little harder.  Granted, this was the first and only I had there, so I can't necessarily base the entire shop on that one dopio.  All in all, I'm saying it was good, and while the extraction time was right, it could use a little more density.

The drip (see: pour-over) clearly used the same roast, which isn't a complaint.  The same chocolatey, creamy notes were abound.  I feel the dosing was very light, and should have either been a 12oz, or more grounds used.  I actually felt I was drinking a water heavy coffee.  Not terrible, but certainly not great.  I have a sneaking suspicion if the measurement was a bit closer, it would have been a much better brew.  Pour-overs are an art first, for sure, then a science.  I think they have potential here.  Maybe a better pot would help with this brew method as well.


-- I'll be back.  My experience was neither mind-blowing nor off-putting.  I'm hoping after they get into the swing of things and get the kinks ironed out, this will be one of the cooler stops in PHX.  Certainly a great concept and whatnot.

Four stars because the staff is nice, the menu is fun, and the food is good BUT, nowhere is perfect. 

So, yes, it's not cheap. But consider what everything is made of before being a baby. Everything is delicious, everything is vegan, and a great deal of it is organic.

The Tsoynamis are a blast and the soft serve is perfect. The breakfast burritos are great, the cake is always dense and flavorful, and I can't wait to try the donuts.

Some things are GENUINELY overpriced, however, but hey. Trial and error. I love Nami and I like to try something new every time I go.

Great place for vegan delight! 

If your looking for a vegan friendly coffee / dessert spot in CenPho, I can think of none better than Nami. I came here for the Tsoynami (a vegan friendly dq blizzard) and was not dissapointed. While I don't think you can ever really compare apples to apples when it comes to dairy desserts and non dairy alternatives, it's about as close as you will find. (I wonder if they have one with apples? probably not). I don't think I will ever really find a replacement for my froyo love.

I can't attest for how healthy they are; I imagine the fat content is fairly low, since it is soy based. For those carb / sugar conscious - the ingredients info isn't really posted anywhere, but I imagine there is a fair amount of sugar in whatever toppings, cookies, and candies that go into your frozen dessert. Just do a couple extra sit-ups, it's worth it!

Tsoynamis are my new obsession. They're SO good -- I wouldn't miss ice cream at all if I was a vegan and only had these. I would still pick these any day to save on calories and fat. It's a great dessert stop after going to Green next door (also yummy!).

Nami is super hip and cute when you walk in ans the store is very quaint and creative. They don't have too many gluten free options everyday but they have enough to definitely stop by. There ice cream is homemade and there are tons of options in that realm. I got the rocky road and the homemade marshmallows were creamy and tasted really fresh. The entire dessert was very refreshing. I usually don't like cheesecake but I tried the gluten free one and it was delicious. This place is definitely worth a try.

I love ice cream! I have loved ice cream since I was old enough to taste food. When I decided to change my diet to plant based I wasn't sure if I would be able to enjoy ice cream. This place make my dreams come true. I forget it's not made out of dairy. All I know is that it is delicious. Many different varieties for everyone to enjoy copies, pastries, and some simple menu items. I go to Green next door and come here for ice cream afterwards.

a MUST GO! I had the brunch special of Texas French toast with tempeh bacon, peanut butter, rasped drizzle and a scramble and hash and it was amazing! My friend had a breakfast burrito and it was huge and delicious as well. Not a lot of places to sit or tables but still worth it. No doubt I'll be back multiple times. Super creative menu

Awesome for gluten free! Ice cream creations, donuts, cheesecake, granola, cookie dough, etc. We don't live in the area but they let me know they do special orders and catering. They also have a lot of vegan options if that's something you need.

Such yummy vegan treats. Great to have a place where you can order anything and its vegan. The cupcakes are great. Someone bought me a dozen for my birthday and everyone loved them, even the meat eaters. There's one that looks and tastes like a hoho. If your lucky enough to see one in the case, get it. The soynami is out of this world. Think of a dairy queen blizzard made with soy milk and no chemical junk. Soooooo good. Prepare to wait and to stand in line. It's a popular place and some things e made to order. It's worth it.

This place is right by work so it is a regular stop. Staff is friendly and service is fast. In the summer the tsoynami is a yummy treat, especially the rocky road. The rest of the year I treat myself to a latte or an Italian soda and a sweet treat like a cupcake or other pastry.

Try the strawberry agave Italian soda....delicious!

This is such a cute coffee shop. My husband, two children, and I went for Sunday morning coffee and doughnuts. I ordered the Cactus Haboob and my husband ordered a Dirty Chai Latte. We also ordered Blueberry Coconut and White Chocolate/Dark Chocolate doughnuts. The coffee and doughnuts were awesome! I don't usually go downtown Phoenix, but this little excursion felt like a touristy getaway for the morning. It will take a little time for the baristas to get your order to you when there is actually a line out the door, but that didn't bother us. I highly recommend everyone to try this place out.

He menus is really cool and the quality is awesome you can't believe there is no dairy in it! It taste good! I would come back here! I haven't tried the pastry yet but it's on the list! The atmosphere is really cool and casual and awesome to hang out with couple of friends or bringing your date!

Came here a while back with a friend and it was definitely worth the drive! Parking  was a bit tight since it's a pretty small place. I can't remember the exact flavor of my tsoynami, something with bananas, but it was so, so good. I also got a quiche to go and that was delicious as well. I'll definitely be back!

A little pricey for breakfast if you're looking for a weekly routine, but this place has one of the most fun brunches I've had in a long time. My brunch companion is very much NOT a vegan, but loved everything we got on the menu (including the blueberry maple glazed vegan donut)! Good addition to the choices on 7th St. in downtown Phoenix!

I've been eating at Green for seven years, so when the building for Nami was purchased fairly recently, I was excited to see what they would do with it! Their vegan soft serve has always been incredible and you can get it at both of the Green restaurants, but what I love about Nami is that they have A LOT of different baked goods and beverages! I no longer live in Arizona, so when I visit family, I always have to stop by to purchase a box of treats. Their Yankee Doodles are amazing, as well as everything else I've ever had there. The parking is atrocious and you're better off parking elsewhere and just walking to the restaurant if you plan on sitting and not just sending someone in the pick something up for you.

A good friend always raves about this place so I decided to meet her there for a dessert & chat this afternoon. The Coffee Coco Loco tSoynami was just OK. Cappuccino was average. Conversation with a good friend is what made this visit special. 2 Stars and nothing more. Cheers***

Favorite brunch spot ever! If you're into something spicy try the Chiliquiles! SO GOOD!! Then when you want dessert try their Tsoynami. So good you won't miss dairy. Kudos NAMI and Green- excellent food.
After school delight with my daughter. Our 1st time here. We loved it! Delicious and a GREAT staff! We will definitely be back!
I LOVE the product, but it takes so long to get your order that I've been late getting back to work.
Good lord these folks were super happy to be serving up vegan treats. Always good when a 5YO doesn't want to share his "ice cream."

Really yummy . I haven't been here in over a year since moving out of town and I was craving some of their delicious vegan ice cream. The place is exactly the same with some new faces . The serving size seems smaller and my better finger was lacking Chico sticks but was great none the less. Still the same Nami I remember :-) 

Great for an adventurous date or little snack downtown.

I cannot rave enough about this place - the environment, the people, but specifically, those tsoynami's. As a dairy free lady living in this city, Nami is everything I could ask for when it comes to desserts! I'm a local at Nami, and you know it's bad when they know your name at the order stand. I cannot get enough of their cookie dough, also.
Came here with some friends, the staff was all really nice, super cool hip spot with awesome vegan stuff, definitely coming back!
Sooo good! The fluffernutterin' and churro donuts are my favorite. Friendly staff, awesome food/drinks; I just wish there were more locations!
Other than the limited seating, I have nothing but good things to say about this place.  You will not regret it.

4 stars for the food. Treated sons to soy based soft serve. Both loved it and oldest couldn't tell difference from reg. Daughter loved the raspberry donut. The menu board could be more reader friendly, especially for newbies to nami. Parking is very limited. Maybe because it was very busy but felt the staff could have been more helpful with questions.  Will go again when in area.
This bakery was delicious!! I wish they had an east valley location! They have amazing food for health-conscious folks like me.

Stopped in for a couple coffee drinks around noon, on a week day. Only 2 other people in the place. The cashier didn't even say hello or make eye contact. I felt like I was bothering her. The latte I received was not good, my husbands drink was though. I wanted to see what kind of food/snacks they had, but in reality I'll probably never be back.

The food is delicious but it's seriously overpriced. The people who work there are nice but the decor is minimal. I really hate that vegan/vegetarian food is always crazy expensive. I liked this place but it's not nice enough to go here for a special occasion, so I probably won't be back.

best vegan donuts in AZ! and the nami mc muffin sandwich is equally amazing. love this place, the food is always exceptional and the staff is really nice as well. i would recommend, and say its a must if you live here  or are traveling through phoenix.
Nami never disappoints, delicious breakfast meals and amazing unique deserts! I'm going to use them for our wedding cake and cupcakes, all my non vegan friends love it too!

If you want delicious (and vegan) treats, including the best soft serve around - come enjoy a frozen tsoynami blended tsoft serve, a donut or amazing weekend brunch. We love the betterfinger .....ymmm!

I have converted from vegetarian to veganism since the time of my original review. Now I love Nami even more!

Favourite tsoynamis: PB & J, Banana Cream Pie, Lemonbar (when they have it!) and also the Funny Bunny that was around briefly in the spring. 

If you follow them on Facebook or Instagram you can be lured to come in by their yummy photos, which happens to me on a regular basis. 

I often meet non-vegan friends here and they've all loved it as well.

I was first referred to Nami (and Green!) when I moved out to Phoenix through a very friendly vegan. Coming from Chicago, I fully expected to find fewer quality vegan options in the city of Phoenix. After my first visit to Nami, I was clearly proven WRONG. From the delicious vegan donuts to the surprisingly tasty orange juice-espresso drink, to the infamous Sunday Nami brunch, I fell in love. 

But my favorite part? Their soynami, which is a guilt-free version of a McFlurry; a vegan's dream in a cup of yum. I've even taken my S.O., an avid meat eater, to try their breakfast burritos. It's his new favorite breakfast spot. Vegans and meat eaters alike, rejoice! 

The staff is always so friendly and even recognizes their regulars. The owner is a passionate, dedicated vegan man who understands what a passion for animals really is. 

If you're looking for a healthy, environmentally-conscious meal that tickles your tastebuds, look no further. Nami is your next stop.
Awesome breakfast place! Great healthy way to start your day! Breakfast burrito is awesome.  Enjoy a great cappuccino as well. I love their vegan ice creams!

This weird place serves both Vietnamese and Neo-Japanese cuisine. The combination of cuisine is weird, no lie, but the service and the fact the restaurant was clean, well lit and well decorated gives it an edge.

I ordered a Large bowl of pho, with a beef, and chicken salad to share. The pho was alright, however, it was not hot enough and lacked a tad of complexity that should be brought up by the spice mix that goes into the soup. The salads were ok, the chicken salad was heavily peppered and the beef salad could have been a tad spicier. Ok place if you are in the neighborhood.

So glad that I found this place. Caters to my no dairy and gluten-free life and even does it while tasting amazing! 
The coffee is hot and food is so amazing you'd never know there is anything missing.

Nami was my first and last stop on my weeklong Arizona trip. I came here for the Cactus Haboob and a vegan donut to get me going on the road to Tucson. When I came back to Phoenix, I got a tsoynami. It was packed that evening and I sat next to another traveler. I loved the tsoynami and the staff so much that I came back before I left for a tsoynami at 10am. They'll serve them to you any time of the day. They have fun combinations or you can make your own - it's a vegan "Blizzard." I wanted everything in their bakery case and I'm pretty picky with my fresh baked desserts. I wish we had this in LA.
Nice atmosphere but the place is small and they did not have that great of a variety when I went there for breakfast. Their granola is great but acai bowl was ok..not too tasty.

For those with allergies or food sensitivities, Nami is a great place to go to! I had the tsoynami with a friend as a treat, and it was so good. I had the Coffee Coco Loco tsoynami, which came with chocolate, coffee, and little pieces of crispy rice. My friend had the Almond Oy Vey, which came with coconut flakes, chocolate syrup, and almond silvers. Keep in mind that both of these "ice cream" were gluten free and dairy free, and it was amazing how good it tasted! The tsoynamis were a bit lighter and icier than their traditional heavier icecream counterparts, but I liked it better the tsoynami way. 

Nami also has quiche, pastries, shakes, yogurt parfaits, gluten free donuts, as well as vegan donuts and brunch on select days. 

Will be definitely going back to try their gluten free donuts and their parfaits before work, and definitely will be back for some tsoynami treats - I'll post pictures! In a happy food coma right now... Highly recommended.

All I can say is this coffee/ice cream/sweet shop is inspirational!  Coupled with it's parent restaurant in the same parking lot, you are certainly in for a great night of eats!

All of my experiences have been nothing short of amazing.  I have eaten at Nami for breakfast, desert after lunch, desert after dinner and for a mid-day snacks.

The coffee is all vegan and fair trade and they offer all kinds of milks to add in with your lattes and such.  Packaging for the coffee is also awesome.  For breakfast, you can opt for some power vegan bars sitting on the counter, quiche or search through the sweets display case.  For deserts, my favorite is the cupcake which was inspired with the Hostess cake but it's vegan!  That's right... chocolaty-goodness with white cream filing and icing on top! oh my!  They also have a chai cupcake which has a cinnamon-like icing on top... yum yum!  They have snicker doodles with icing sandwiched in between and mini-cookies to scarf down.  Everything is vegan!  They are famous for something known as a soy-nami but I've never made it to the vegan ice cream!  I'm always opting for the aforementioned sweets!  If I ever get to one, I will review again... They also do sundaes and live music on Sunday nights.

For dinner, walk across the parking lot to Green Pastures.  See my review for this restaurant as well.
Great for brunch, good coffee! Fast and friendly service! The wings are awesome, and even if you are not a vegetarian you will like this place!
This place is good for a ice cream with a lot of stuff in it. I'm more of a simple person. My girlfriend on the other hand loves to mix everything up. Parking sucks.

food is amazing. customer service is amazing.
parking is a pain in the ass. they have the most amazing vegan ice cream & treats ever

Nami and Green are the best vegan places to go in Phoenix.  My wife and I go regularly but we got married a few months ago and Morgan at Nami made our wedding cake.  It couldn't have been more perfect!  Morgan also arranged for breakfast and lunch on our wedding day to be made for us and our wedding party.  Morgan had made everything perfect and got things delivered and looking perfect for us.  Would definitely have them cater and have her make another cake for a different occasion.  They set up a taste testing day for us and worked great with us.  Everyone loved the cake and how creative it was.  Love this place.

We went here three times on our vacation. Twice for breakfast and once for their mint tsoynami. My husband loved their pour over coffee. It isn't instant coffee so you need a tiny bit of patience and it's totally worth it. we got breakfast burritos each time and the second time I was feeling like I probably shouldn't do a burrito again and vocalized it and the lady at the counter suggested I do it as a plate-- Not on the menu (that I noticed) and super nice of her. I did and I had no regrets. Their chocolate doughnut was out of this world. Definitely coming back for multiple trips next time I visit family in AZ.
I love this place so much. Their deserts and coffee are so bomb. It's a bit small and a bit pricey, but soooo worth it.
I love this place!  Absolutely amazing!  Great breakfast and sweets!  AND YES!  it's VEGAN!

Great little place! Nice to see something different like this in Arizona. The sister restaurant next door is excellent.

Had a soy-ft serve sundae, awesome. Had an iced coffee, so delighted by all the options for vegan-friendly milk (soy, almond, rice, etc). 

Great place, good luck!

1 thing - the wood spoons, while I'm sure are biodegradable and all, have a weird texture with the ice cream (at least for me). I think those spoons just kind of freak me out. I didn't ask for plastic or metal, I'm sure they would have accommodated.

Nami is the place to go when you are looking for a yummy treat (vegan or not)! The doughboy tsoynami is my favorite and a close second is the NO's n Mint. You cant go wrong with any tsoynami flavor honestly. I would pretty much recommend everything, other than the peanut butter bar thing they sell at the front and the baked chocolate chip cookies, which I have found to be a little hard and dry. The staff are always super friendly and helpful, and the whole place is super chill. Sometimes its a little busy, but the line usually moves  quickly, and the wait time to get your yummy treat is not long at all. I have taken my non vegan friends here and everyone loves it too! Honestly I cant get enough!!

Been here a few times over the past month and i have to say: THIS PLACE IS DA BOMB! I'm not personally vegan, and this place still holds a sweet spot in my heart. My only problem, sometimes it can smell a bit like a gym inside, but there's chairs outside so problem solved. Check this place out if you're looking for some good dessert.

Tsoynamis are one of my favorite foods in the world. I'm lactose intolerant and love blizzards, so it's a match made in heaven. I go to Green a lot as I live nearby, and have never felt unwelcome there, so I had no reason to think I'd feel that way about their sister joint, Nami. So after a disappointing dinner at Nobou at Teeter House in downtown phx, bf and I were excited to turn our night around with dessert at Nami when we realized we were super close to it and it was still open (since Green would have been closed by the time we got there). Their hours posted indicate they close at 9:30pm on Fridays, and we arrived at 9:20 after calling to confirm they were still open. 

We walked in, and there were a few groups of people sitting and leisurely enjoying their ice cream and baked goods. We walked up to the counter and bf knew what he wanted right away (s'mores tsoynami with pb added...SO good!). I, on the other hand, needed a minute to decide since they had a huge bakery case filled with things I never see at Green and wanted to try out, in addition to the full tsoynami menu. 

I asked a few questions, which the light-haired woman working there was happy to answer. She disappeared to make bf's tsoynami, though, and we were then met with an icy stare and complete annoyance by the dark-haired woman working there. I like to give people the benefit of the doubt, and hey, it's Friday night and she probably wanted to close up so she could go out. But it wasn't even 9:30, and she had zero interest in making this customer happy. 

I said I was debating between a cookie and a tsoynami, while she rolled her eyes and continued to tap her fingers on the counter. Her response, rather than a suggestion or recommendation for something to order, was, "We close in five minutes." Ok? I know that already? Why wouldn't you just try to hurry us along in a constructive way, rather than making me feel afraid to ask you any questions about your products?

She continued to sigh and look around, willing us to disappear, and honestly I wish we would have left right then. But we were starving, and I really wanted to enjoy one of their delicious looking treats. I decided in my head that I wanted a tsoynami, but I was way too afraid to have that lady actually prepare something for me as I was pretty sure she would spit in it, in addition to the length of time it would have taken to prepare which surely would have put us over her 5-minute limit. I said I'd take the cookie, to get us out of there sooner. We still had to wait another minute for bf's tsoynami to be finished, and felt her stare us down the whole time. Mind you, there are still parties of other customers at tables still lingering. We were definitely NOT responsible for keeping them open, but we sure were made to feel that way!

I don't care how tasty your treats are, I would never EVER go back there...who wants to leave a dessert place with such a sour taste in their mouth? I will be getting all of my future tsoynamis at Green, where they never make me feel like I'm doing something wrong by asking questions or spending a minute debating between a few items.

A cute small place with delicious treats! So worth the late night snack :p 

It's one of the unique places in phx

Super delicious late night indulgence. We have tsunami banana ice cream and a coconut haystack type of cookie dessert. Both fabulous. When we walked it (we are from out of town) there was no one else there so we were a little worried. We must have hit it just right because it was about 8pm on a Wednesday night. Within 5 minutes of placing our order, the place got super busy. While we ate, it cleared out and filled up again. Everyone seemed to be pretty regular. Nice clean restroom out back - very friendly staff working. If I had any suggestions it would be to have a space planner come in and help figure out better seating. The wall seating was fine but a little awkward because of table placement. People might hang out a little more if the seating was better. We will be back!

As good as it gets--great tasting, cruelty-free breakfasts, treats and desserts!

Love the people and the food.

Come, eat, experience joy:-)
Food was great! Staff was very kind. However I did not see any lizards so I give this a 4/5 stars.

I only came back here to meet a friend for breakfast. It was so disgusting. I ordered a green tea latte, they gave me a green tea (made with with a teabag) topped with some foam. Not a real matcha green tea like you get anywhere else. I sent it back. The breakfast plate I had (something hasheesh) looked like it was made by a 10 year old child. In fact, a child would have done a better job. The tofu scramble was dry as were the "hash" potatoes. The "sausage" was some nasty soy thing topped with that nasty Daiya fake cheese sitting in a puddle of grease.

Do yourself a favor and head over to Loving Hut if you want good and healthy vegan food. Nami is yet another overpriced, trendy disappointment in central Phoenix operated by people who have no clue about good food.

Wowzers! An unpretentious, quality restaurant serving some delicious food. I showed up 30 minutes before brunch and figured that was the way to go. I ordered the tres leche frech toast and the "buffalo wings." The tres leche french toast was phenomenl. I wanted to pick up the [late and lick it clean. The sauce was what really made the meal and I couldnt believe it was vegan! The buffalo wings hit the spot with that specific flavor. They also had a nice texture against the teeth. One thing I will say is parking is ATROCIOUS and lines can be just as bad. With some patience, it's definitely worth coming here. I wanted dessert, but I had a big day ahead of me and could not ruin my appetite.

I come here perhaps more often that I should. Tsoynamis are my downfall *queue up Price is Right fail horn*. But then again, its better than blubbering over to Dairy Queen and crying inside an M&M Blizzard of shame.

Inside this hopping hub inspired by the geniuses of Green is part bakery, part ice cream shop, and part coffe haus....sprinkled with brunch awesomeness in the morning and on weekends. This is my go-to spot for any sweet treat, because as my friends know I do not eat crap. I am now on primarily a low-calorie, low carb, primarily vegan/fish based diet. I watch what I eat and work out regularly.

How does Nami fit in? After a stressful day, instead of grabbing 5 beers and nachos, or a heaping 3 scoop fatty ice cream, I come here. I grab a 100% soy-based ice cream treat called a Tsoynami, which comes with dozens of variations made up by Nami. My personal favorite is The Doughboy, with vanilla soy soft serve and 100% organic chocolate chip cookie dough. Horrible for you? Meh, not great by any means. Better than Coldstone. Actually, you could probably have two Tsoynamis and be still way better off than anything Coldstone, Baskin Robbins, or Dairy Queen has to offer. 

They also have a very high quality coffee bar which provides basic coffee fair, along with a dizzying arrangement of baked goods all vegan friendly. The vegan doughnuts blow my mind. I have yet to dance the doughnut dance at Nami, but I can do an eye test and say "I approve".  Overall, I can't give this place enough love. It's super trendy, the food on the weekends (look at their menu) are so to die for gang...its delicious. Green is a business genius for concocting the awesomeness that is Nami. They have this man happy, and a customer for life. Enjoy, 5 stars.... for everything they have here. Just go, if you haven't been yet. Just do it already!

Vegan - check !
Caffeine - check !
Friendly - check ! 

I love this place. Great food, excellent service and then soynami!  I want to dock a star for the interwebs not working but it couldve been a glitch. I sure as heck will be going back once this sun cools off !

LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE! All Vegan. You have to try their ice cream blizzards! All different flavors, only $5. I got the s'mores and I came back and got the cookie dough too. Both so good! They have vanilla, chocolate or twist. Of course, you don't have to get the blizzard. You could get just get an ice cream cone or cup too. I loved this place so much that I came back yet again for their breakfast! We got the special which was a breakfast pizza. Such big portions! Didn't end up trying any of their sweets but they looked delicious! Also had plenty of gluten free options. They have a very SMALL parking lot. Staff was very friendly. Bathrooms located outside. Only downside was they charge more for almond milk in my house brew coffee. LIKE WHY?! You are an all vegan café. That being said that was my only compliant. Great vegan café!

I have been to Nami and Green a handful of times and the service is inconsistent. Sometimes you get you order in less then 10 minutes, and other times it takes upwards of 20-30 minutes. The one thing that is consistent is the unfriendliness of the staff. If I was rating the food alone I would give 4 stars but because of the customer service, I give them 3 stars.

Trying out a tSoynami should be on everyone's bucket list. These DQ Blizzard-style treats will dispel any preconceived notions about vegan food. My favorite tSoynamis are the Dough Boy and the Rocky Road.

Also, they have amazing donuts--you just have to get there early enough to snag one!

If you know any vegan food haters, get them a tSoynami and watch their pessimism quickly turn into brain freeze.

The only reason I'm giving Nami a 4 stars instead of a 5 is because it seems like they are still figuring out their breakfast/brunch situation. The last time I went in for brunch things seemed a little disorganized and the food wasn't as good as their dessert items.

Sadly their ice cream machine was down the day I visited and they were out of many things, but I knew I couldn't leave without at least trying something! I got a dark chocolate raspberry donut and oh my god was it moist and delicious. I'm not sure if all vegan donuts are just blessed with this ability to be so moist and delicious or I've just been lucky; either way I'm not complaining. I can't wait to go back and actually get a Tsoynami and compare it to J. Selby's Soyclone from home here.
The top vegan cafe to get comfort food in uptown Phoenix. Required eating when in Phoenix.
Oh my goodness! I went here for the first time tonight and got a Mystery Mash Tsoynami.. I love the service, and my treat was deeeeeelicious!! I'll definitely be coming back

I love this vegan dessert place. The banana cream tsoynami was great. But I think the whipped cream is made with coconut milk, which I hate. There wasn't too much of it and the ice cream itself had a really nice texture, so I ignored the whipped cream. 
The chai tsoynami had excellent flavors and some type of crunchy graham crackers mixed inside. So yummy!
The white chocolate raspberry donut, which was also gluten free, was not so good. The flavor was kinda funky and we couldn't finish it. 
I would love to return to try other things next time I'm in AZ.

By far my favorite vegan desserts. I have been to other vegan bakeries and the pastries taste bland. Nami nailed it! But I wouldn't expect anything less since the Parent Restaurant Green is the most delicious food I've ever had. I wish I lived closer to downtown Phoenix because I would go every weekend. The vibe is always super chill and friendly. Plus you can just pop over to Green and have brunch!

Sadly disappointed. I ordered multiple items to try some of their stuff out. And the only thing I was content with was the Italian soda i ordered. The other items were either too strong in a flavor or not strong enough. The ice cream was alright as well. Just wasn't all that for me i guess. And I've had plenty delicious vegan treats to know that vegan treats can be way better then dairy treats. And these did not make that list.

Good donuts and I'm not vegan.  I like all kinds of donuts and these are consistency wise like cake.  Lighter that a buttermilk bar.  They use same donuts with different toppings.  Time we went took 10-16 mins to get drink order. Phone orders slow service down.  So if you like vegan I would say try it for yourself.  For me...probably not coming back.

Great Americanos and lattes. Haven't jumped on their baked good as there is just something off to me about vegan products but I'll leave that stuff to the kids that love it :)

Apparently I need to try their frozen soft-serve thang... Soynami...it's where it's at i keep hearing. 

Great great great job on the renovation of the building and thoughtful material choices and design. A very nice addition to 7th street. Nice to see, said the Phoenix native :)

I wouldn't even know where to start with this place. My girlfriend and I visited this place after eating at the American vegetarian next door, which had seemed to be connected to this cafe. There were so many vegan options. They had cookies to cupcakes. Their coffees did not look half bad either. Within the 3 days I spent in Phoenix, I found myself here 3 times as well. 
We were so stoked to find vegan biscuits and gravy here. They came with some potato square hash and some tofu scramble which had to be some of the best i have had yet. I also got the country breakfast burrito which was so good as well. The worker was so nice when i had asked for ketchup and had to go in the back to get it for me. 
As for desserts, their soynamis were pretty much a soy soft serve. I was not a huge fan of their chocolate one, so I found myself happier when I ordered just the vanilla with my soynamis. Over the course, I tried the cookie dough one (which was a bit sweet when ordered with swirl), the mint one (which was so fun with the vanilla), and the marshmallow one (which was probably my favorite). The workers here were so nice. The place was so nice. I'm kind of glad I don't live in Phoenix. I would be there way too often and would probably give them all of my money.
You have to try the big ol burrito and there McBegal!! Only downside is the overly priced donuts and pastries.. other then that we love it

I would probably give this place a solid 3 or 4 just for existing! But, it bothers me greatly that the staff doesn't know what is in the food. When I asked what they use in the lemon bars the response was "I have no idea". I came in again with my friend, and we both ordered tsoynami. They made his first, then a bunch of other people- nearly 19 minutes later mine was ready. My friend tried to wait to eat his, but it was melting. So, by the time I had mine- I was eating alone. It really didn't make sense. 

Conclusion- a vegan restaurant should really know what's in the food. Many people adopt this lifestyle because of food allergies and various other concerns. Improve workflow and service. Right now you are below standard, but you have the potential to be great.

I have friends who have been raving about this place, so when we were with them recently, we decided to stop in and try out Nami.  My bf and I were right in the middle of a 30-day vegan challenge and beginning to miss desserts... Bring on the tSoynami! This is a soft serve, soy-based blizzard type of dessert.  They mix in just about anything you can imagine and its all vegan!  I had the cookie dough; bf had the mixed berries.  We got huge portions (I didn't finish mine) and they were both delicious.  They have a great looking pastry case (vegan donuts?!) that I did not indulge in this stop.  I decided I needed an afternoon pick me up, so I got myself a caramel mockiato as I saw they house make their vegan caramel. That caramel was amazing and the soy milk was frothed up to perfection! Wayyy better than anything you've ever had at Starbucks!  I can't imagine any ways to improve... Vegan desserts abound and the tastiest coffee.  Their breakfast and brunch menu looks amazing too.  Next time I'm downtown for breakfast, this place will be in mind!
Amazing. My only regret is not buying more than one gf donut. Would recommend to anyone with dietary restrictions.
Great little place. Staff is very friendly. Owner is a hard worker and attentive. My daughter got the yogurt parfait and she loved it. Will come again.

Being a Nutrition fanatic, I decided to incorporate Veganism into my diet (6 days on with 1 cheat day). I went into this place and absolutely everything is vegan so I don't have to worry about modifications. The atmosphere is laid back and cool and so is the staff! Very friendly and unique personalities to be found here.
The coffee is delicious and the food is good as well. I wish there was more to choose from other than only baked goods and quiche, but that won't keep me from becoming a frequent customer.

Love this place!!!  When I get downtown I try to eat here.  There is nothing really bad about Nami or Green except parking.   I have never ate anything I disliked there.  They are accommodating to groups of people too.   I hope they expand to the west side or north side of Phoenix!

So we wanted ice cream, and didn't think this visit would turn into an escapade. Ordered the the peach cobbler ice cream. My friend is deathly allergic to cashews. Little did we know the storemade granola contained cashews which is in the peach cobbler ice cream. When my friend noticed cashews were in her ice cream, she kindly asked the girl working the register if there were cashews, the girl said yes. She informed the cashier that she is severely allergic and to that the cashier said "oh well we have it posted" and pointed to a tiny sign in the kitchen. There was no reaction as to the well being of my friend. We looked over the menu again and there was absolutely no warning that there were nuts in the ice cream the only warning was that there may be cross contamination between all food products offered. Will not be visiting as the gals working were very rude and terrible.

I had the caramel macchiato with an herb cream cheese everything schmagel. So delicious. My girls had strawberry and chocolate ice cream respectively, and my sister had the strawberry Italian soda and the plain bagel with organic ham to avoid soy. All four of us were more than satisfied with the service, the treat, and the helpfulness to accommodate a soy allergy! Thanks, Namians!

A bit of a trek from where we were, but props to this store for being open on labor day weekend. The venue's a little small, the staff a little harried despite the lack of a line and the limited menu items. Despite the wait, we managed to obtain one of each of the cupcakes to try - a little dry, but they were tasty enough that i couldn't believe they were vegan! Would come again if it was closer and/or the wait wasn't so long.

Baked vegan desserts are great, if a bit on the dense side. Their shakes, which are like their version of a vegan McFlurry are dope! The interior has a cool, punk vibe. The only thing that would make them even better was if they offered a few more savory options for folks who want more than just sweets.

i came here for the Sunday brunch in July when my boyfriend visited me. i got the benedict arnold plate and he got wing ding dang plate.

the tofu scramble that comes with every meal tastes only of tumeric. not good. they need to throw some kala namak in there to give it more of an authentic egg flavor. the hash potatoes were okay - they really needed ketchup but no ketchup was to be found.

i tried one of my boyfriend's wings and it was one of the foulest things i have ever tasted. there was way too much vinegar in the sauce. yet, he still somehow loved them. i'm convinced that boy has no taste whatsoever.

i've never had nonvegan hollandaise sauce so i have nothing to compare it to, but the hollandaise sauce that came on my plate just tasted like mustard to me. which, i imagine, is not the way hollandaise is supposed to taste.

despite all this, the donuts are TO DIE FOR. I got a maple bar and ohhhhhh my god! it tasted just like the real deal! 

i don't know WHAT they make their canadian bacon out of, but it is the best dang canadian bacon i have EVER had! it tastes JUST like regular ham! 

on your way out, they also have some refreshing complimentary cucumber water which i really enjoyed. 

i wish i could give this place more stars simply for being an all-vegan restaurant, but the food is either hit or miss. would i come here again? absolutely. but probably just for the amazing donuts and canadian bacon. :^)

Sunday donuts???? how bout that. after months of clean living, we decided to treat ourselves to a dessert. we remembered Nami from a previous eating out at Green. We swung by and lo and behold...Sundays feature donuts!!!!

the wife had the coffee donut and i had the coconut. both were freaking delicious. truth be told, i thought mine was better. they're not the light donuts like krispy kreme, but more "doughy" but not cake-ey like. they taste like donuts ok! delicious donuts. and some are gluten and soy free if you're into that. 

order at the counter, service is quick, efficient. and it was crazy busy from the brunch crowd right before 2pm. parking is tight....best to leave the H3 at home.

Going to nami, I wasn't really sure what to expect. I recently made a lifestyle change of wanting to eat more of a plant based diet for my health so hearing about a vegan dessert place was pretty cool. However, I was not impressed with my experience. It seems as if they try to make up for lack of flavor by dumping pounds of sugar into their desserts. Seriously some of the sweetest things I've ever eaten. Texture of ice cream was okay but the aftertaste was not pleasant. I did like the snickerdoodle cookie but overall I do not see myself returning due to the lack of true flavor and crazy amounts of sugar in their desserts.

Vegan sweets is a real thing people. I'm not even Vegan which means when I tell you this place is nothing short of terrific! I really mean it's absolutely delicious Vegan cream or ice cream whatever you want to call it. I don't care because every bite was amazing. Best thing about living in the hot weather is eating cold things. Vegan up folks because your missing out if you don't. The DOHboy is the Nami take on a Cookie Dough Blizzard without the stomachache later. Thumbs up all the way on these great treats.

I love the food here and it's pretty much one of 3 vegan/vegetarian spots in Phoenix but the service is UNBELIEVABLY slow. I don't even walk in the door if there is a line. Even with no line it took about 20 minutes to get an acai bowl on a Wednesday at 10:40am. Don't ever come here if you're in a hurry, but it's a lovely place to sit and chat a whole morning away with a friend.

This was one of the famous places I wanted to try for dessert in Phoenix.  The place is a vegan soft serve place with lots of other baked goods.  The soft serve had many interesting flavors, I got the chai tiramisu, since it sounded delicious and a great combo of flavors.  The flavor itself was really good and the price was pretty reasonable considering the quality.  It was 5 dollars for a small cup, but pretty good.  There is a small area for parking in the back!

Nami-you had me at hello!

My sweet tooth is SO thankful this exists and that it is close to my work site (though I'd prefer it was closer to my home-pretty please consider setting up another one in Chandler/Gilbert??? :). I'm a loyal Green customer (no restaurant has topped this restaurant as far as I know, NATIONALLY!!), and Nami is an exciting addition. I haven't gone there for Brunch, but I do plan on very very soon! 

I can't pick a favorite because everything is good there. I like to try a new Tsoynami flavor each time I go there. I love their play on their toppings such as Captain Crunch and how it brings back childhood memories. 

This is a place I would bring my non-vegans to-not one of them has walked away disappointingly.

We went there today to try it out what the hype was all about. Sorry this place is overrated. They make those vegan "ice cream shakes" with no love into them whatsoever. They look like someone ate it and it came out of them again. Your eyes eat with!!!  I had to search for my mango and berries that were supposed to be in them.
Vegan gluten free donut also not tasty. It tasted like a cheap packed ready mix. To pricey for what it is.
I love trying new things especially little places, but nope there is better places in and around PHX then this. 
2 Stars only because they are somehow trying to make a "healthy" version of a cafe vs a chain.

Cool place. I'm not vegan or a vegetarian and I still enjoy everything. The food is prepared well and very tasty. I like their buffalo "wings", a very good spicy. I also had their Carmel mockiato, and have had their cactus haboob coffee. Their cactus haboob is a little bit better for me only because the Carmel drink can be a little too sweet for me sometimes. If you ask for less syrup, it's better for me. Their donuts are delicious! I really liked the guava. Was very dense and tasted like a more natural sweet glaze donut. We both really enjoyed it!
